Ellas quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “estamos agradecidos con sus préstamos, gracias a ustedes podemos emprender un negocio nos dan nuevas oportunidades de salir adelante”:
texts.en:
Ana Lilia, aged 21, is married and the mother of two young boys. She sells footwear via catalog. She applies for this loan to expand her inventory of shoes and sneakers for women, men and children. She launched her business four months ago with a Kiva loan. Her business is important for her, because she can contribute to family expenses and she likes going out and offering her products to her neighbors in the community. She offers the shoes with payment facilities. She likes socializing and is proud to sell shoes because she can have an income and care for her children. She uses her profit to invest in new footwear and provide for the needs of her children. She dreams and hopes that people continue to buy her merchandise, that she get more customers, that her children be well nourished and grow up healthy, and that she be able to cover school fees when her children start studying.

Ana Lilia is happy with the loan that she is about to receive. She will use it to expand her business and buy shoes to fulfill her orders. She wants to tell Kiva and the microfinance institution Fundación Realidad: "we are grateful for your loans; thanks to you we can start a business and you give us new opportunities for success."

loans.use: to buy shoes and sneakers for women, men and children.

loans.name: Andrea Gertrudiz

texts.es: Andrea es una mujer de 62 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su tienda y bazar su historia empezó en el año 2004 comenzó su negocio con un pequeño bazar y luego añadió abarrotes y actualmente es tienda, su trabajo lo hace sola todos los días, tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, está soltera, tiene hijos son mayores de edad, su sueño más importante es mejorar su negocio que tenga más productos y sea la principal del barrio. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su tienda y bazar y asi comprar perfumes, cosmeticos.
texts.en:
Andrea is a 62 year old woman and has many aspirations to grow her general store and stationary shop in the next few years. Her story began in 2004, when she started her own business with a small stationary store and then added groceries so it is now a general store. She works alone everyday and has trouble with crime. 

She is single and has grown up children. Her main dream is to improve her business so that it stocks more products and is the main store in the neighbourhood.

To achieve this she wants a loan for her general store and stationary shop to buy perfume and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es:
Juan tiene 59 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos, tiene casa propia en la que vive con su familia y esta ubicada en un caserío de nombre “CP-2 Colera”, es una comunidad pequeña que por ahora solo tiene el servicio de energía eléctrica, y pertenece al distrito de Tambogrande en la provincia de Piura.

Se dedica a la agricultura varios años atrás actividad que ha sido el sustento de su familia, en la actualidad cuenta con 1has de terreno agrícola en donde ha sembrado plantaciones de limón y mango lo cual comercializa en el mercado local, adicionalmente su esposa cría, engorda y comercializa animales y son aves de corral en su mayoría con lo que esta apoyado a generar ingresos, desean mejorar su calidad de vida por lo que tienen sus objetivos bien planteados.

Sus plantaciones de Juan están necesitando ser abonados para su mejor producción, por lo que esta solicitando un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 900 nuevos Soles los cuales utilizara para la compra de fertilizantes, y así poder ofrecer a mayor precio sus productos.
Es un cliente recurrente para nuestra institución y se le conoce por su alto grado de responsabilidad, lo que también nos refieren sus vecinos que lo conocen.
texts.en:
Juan is 59 years old, married, and has three children.  He owns his own home and lives with his family.  The house is located in a small village called 'CP-2 Colera'.  This is a small community and the only service it receives right now is electricity.  It is located in Tambogrande district, in Piura province.

Juan has been farming for several years and it has been his means of providing for his family.  He currently has one hectare of farmland where he has planted lemons and mangoes which he sells in the local market.  In addition, his wife raises, fattens and sells animals (mainly farmyard birds).  In this way, she supports him in making income.  The couple would like to improve their quality of life and they have well-established goals to achieve.

Juan's crops need to be fertilized so that he can enjoy a better production.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 900 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  He will use his money to buy fertilizers so that he can fetch a better price for his produce.

Juan is an existing client of our institution and he is known for his great responsibility which his neighbors attest to.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Sènoumè Julienne

texts.fr: Sènoumè Julienne est âgée de 33 ans et vit au Bénin. Sènoumè Julienne est mariée à un photographe du nom de Rafiou. Sènoumè Julienne n'a pas trop fréquenté l’école mais, a appris la couture. Le couple a un enfant à leur charge. Sènoumè Julienne et son mari assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Sènoumè Julienne exerce le métier de coiffure et vend des mèches de façon secondaire depuis près de douze ans dans sa région. Sènoumè Julienne s'approvisionne au Nigeria. Cette activité lui permet ainsi de satisfaire aux besoins de sa famille. Sènoumè Julienne désire mieux équiper son atelier de coiffure par l’acquisition des produits de beauté ; ce qui lui permettra de répondre efficacement aux exigences de sa clientèle. Pour cette raison, Sènoumè Julienne sollicite pour la troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Sènoumè Julienne is 33 years old and lives in Bénin. Sènoumè Julienne is married to a photographer named Rafiou. Sènoumè Julienne did not go to school too much but learned to sew. The couple has one dependent child. Sènoumè Julienne and her husband take care of the diverse household responsibilities together. 

In order to take care of her different responsibilities, Sènoumè Julienne has been working as a hairdresser and selling hair extensions as a secondary activity for almost twelve years in her region. Sènoumè Julienne gets her supplies in Nigeria. This business allows her to meet the needs of her family. Sènoumè Julienne wants to better equip her hairdressing shop by purchasing beauty products, which will allow her to effectively meet her clientèle's needs. For this reason, Sènoumè Julienne is requesting a loan from ALIDé for the third time. The two previously received loans were well repaid.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and hair products.

loans.name: Roxana Flor

texts.es:
La señora Roxana es de la ciudad de Pisco, ella tiene 47 años de edad y desde hace aproximadamente 2 años tiene su librería, lugar en el que trabaja a diario.  Roxana empezó con este negocio gracias a los ahorros familiares, la cual se encuentra ubicada en el frontis de su casa, en este tiempo ha tenido una buena acogida por el público, el mismo que vive cerca de la zona en donde ella reside.

Ella junto a su esposo se dedican a este negocio, con estos ingresos económicos pueden cuidar bien de sus pequeños de 11 y 16 años de edad, todos ellos viven en la ciudad de Pisco, lugar que sufrió un fuerte terremoto en el año 2007 y con el tiempo ha podido progresar constantemente.

Es en estos meses donde Roxana necesita poder incrementar la cantidad de sus productos a vender debido a que en las próximas semanas se inicia la temporada escolar en Perú, esta es la época del año en donde Roxana tendrá la oportunidad de incrementar y mucho sus ingresos, pero lamentablemente no tiene el dinero suficiente para comprar todo lo que necesita, es por eso que ha recurrido a la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva con la finalidad de que pueda realizar la compra de algunos cuadernos, folders, hojas, lapiceros, reglas, goma, entre otros, con este apoyo ella desea mejor sus ventar y así consecutivamente hacerse conocida en toda la zona en donde vive para que luego, mejorando todos sus ingresos, pueda abrir su negocio en el centro de la ciudad de Pisco, lugar en donde se realizan mayor cantidad de ventas.
texts.en:
Roxana is from the city of Pisco.  She is 47 years old and has owned a stationery store for approximately two years.  This is where she works every day.  Roxana started this business with some family savings.  The business is located in the front part of her home and has become popular with the people who live nearby.

Roxana and her husband both work in this business.  They use the income to provide good care for their children who are 11 and 16 years old.  The family lives together in the city of Pisco, a place which suffered a strong earthquake in 2007 but which, over time, has been able to develop constantly.

Roxana needs to be able to increase the quantity of products that she has available to sell over the next few months because the school year will start in Peru in the coming weeks.  This is a time of year when Roxana has the opportunity to really increase her income.  Unfortunately, she does not have enough money to buy everything she needs.  For this reason, she is asking for the help of Kiva lenders to buy composition books, folders, paper, pencil sharpeners, rulers, erasers, etc.  With this support, she would like to improve her sales and become better known in her area so that she can improve her income and open a business in Pisco city center where it is possible to make more sales.

loans.use: to buy composition books, folders, paper, pencil sharpeners, rulers, erasers, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy oil, mixed vegetables, tuna, cookies and other products for her store

loans.name: Cecilia Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Cecilia es una mujer de la ciudad de Pisco, ella tiene 30 años de edad  y trabaja aproximadamente más de 1 año como comerciante, Cecilia empezó con este negocio debido a que se encontró en la necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos a raíz que se separo de su esposo, ella pensó en este tipo de negocio debido a que le gustaba atender a las personas, con este negocio ella ha podido sacar adelante a sus dos hermosas hijas, la mayor de 9 y la menor de 4 añitos.

A pesar de muchos momentos fuertes y dificultades diarias ella ha sabido salir adelante con sus pequeñas y está dispuesta a esforzarse mucho más para que ambas se sientan muy orgullosas de ella. Actualmente Cecilia no tiene el dinero necesario para poder realizar la compra al por mayor de arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche y algunos útiles escolares que desea vender por la cantidad de personas que se lo solicitaran al iniciarse la temporada escolar.

Cecilia tiene muchos pedidos y ella sabe que con esta oportunidad podrá vender lo que sus clientes necesitan y así mejorar sus ingresos. Su meta es que en algunos cuantos meses ella llegue a consolidarse como comerciante en su zona y así mismo tener mayor acogida con sus clientes y convertirse en una gran micro empresaria. Otra de sus aspiraciones es lograr convertirse en una gran madre y darles el mejor ejemplo a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a woman from the city of Pisco, she is 30 years old and has worked for more than a year as a shopkeeper. Cecilia started with this business as she needed to find a way to earn her own money as she separated from her husband.She thought of this type of business because she liked helping people, with this business she has been able to support her two lovely daughters, the oldest is 9 and the youngest just 4 years old.

In spite of lots of hard times and difficult days, she has been able to succeed with her little ones and she is willing to put in even more effort so that they can both feel proud of her. Currently, Cecilia does not have the money she needs to be able to buy rice, sugar, noodles, milk and any school supplies, that she wants to sell because of the quantity of people requesting them at the beginning of the school term, at wholesale 

Cecilia has lots of orders and she knows that with this opportunity she will be able to sell what her customers need and improve her income. Her goal is that in a few months she will have established herself as a shopkeeper in her area and be able to offer her customers a better welcome, as well as to make herself a great small business woman. Her other dream is to be a great mother and provide the best possible example to her daughters.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, noodles, milk and school supplies.

loans.name: Froilan

texts.es: El socio continua con su negocio de compra y venta de frazadas, motivo por el cual tambien continua viajando y llevando su mercaderia, el socio  tambien vende sabanas y ahora que esta lloviendo el socio desea invertir een la compra de sabanas de felpa y de polar; el socio poco a poco tambien traera frazadas para la venta y distribucion en los diferentes mercadillos. El socio solicita en esta ocasion el prestamo para invertir en la compra de sabanas y de frazadas para la venta.
texts.en:
This member continues working in his business buying and selling blankets.  He continues traveling and selling his merchandise.  He also sells sheets.  Now that it is raining, he would like to invest in buying terry towelling and fleece sheets.  He will also gradually acquire blankets to sell and distribute in different markets.

On this occasion, the member is requesting a loan to invest in buying sheets and blankets to sell.

loans.use: to invest in buying sheets and blankets

loans.name: Kpèdétin Blandine

texts.fr: Kpèdétin Blandine est mariée à un certain Thomas. Le couple a deux enfants, tous à leur charge. Des deux enfants, un est scolarisé. Kpèdétin Blandine est âgée de 32 ans. Kpèdétin Blandine a appris le métier de photographie. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Kpèdétin Blandine exerce cette activité depuis près de neuf ans et vend aussi de boissons et de bissap de façon secondaire dans sa région. Kpèdétin Blandine s'approvisionne dans sa région et parfois dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but d’agrandir son activité et pour être plus compétitive sur le marché, Kpèdétin Blandine désire augmenter le stock de ses produits ; ce qui lui permettra d’accroitre son chiffre d’affaire. Pour cette raison, Kpèdétin Blandine sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les premier crédit consenti a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Kpèdétin Blandine is married to a certain Thomas. The couple has two children, all under their care. Of the two children, one is in school. Kpèdétin Blandine is 32 years old. 

Kpèdétin Blandine learned the trade of photography. To meet her needs, Kpèdétin Blandine has been practicing this business for almost nine years and also sells beverages and bissap [African drink made with hibiscus flowers] on the side in her region. Kpèdétin Blandine gets her supplies in her region and sometimes in a town in Bénin. 

With the goal of expanding her business and to be more competitive on the market, Kpèdétin Blandine wants to increase the stock of her products, which will allow her to grow her turnover. For this reason, Kpèdétin Blandine is requesting a second loan from ALIDé. The first loan that was granted was well repaid.

loans.use: to buy film, cassettes, bissap leaves and beverages.

loans.name: Mi Bendicion Group

texts.es: El Banco comunal Mi Bendición está conformado  por 9 integrantes que ya han venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000, durante su crédito otorgando este grupo de emprendedores han demostrado ser responsable y con una motivación de crecer, este grupo se  apoyan entre ellos en cada uno de sus negocios que tienen brindándose ideas para superarse. Martha Lorena es una emprendedora que es parte de este grupo, su actividad  a la que se dedica es a una pulpería, ella actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para comprar  productos para la pulpería y ofrecerle a sus clientes lo cual comprara granos básicos, aceite, pan, shampoo, tan, detergentes,  galletas entre otros productos que sus clientes le solicitan.
texts.en:
The "Mi Bendición" ["My Blessing"] communal bank is made up of nine members who have been working with Fundación León 2000.  During their credit period, this group of entrepreneurs has demonstrated that they are very responsible and have motivation for growth.  This group support each other with each one of the business by providing ideas for getting ahead. 

Martha Lorena is an entrepreneur who is part of this group.  The activity that she works in is a convenience store.  She is currently requesting financing to purchase products for her convenience store, and will be able to offer them for sale to her customers.  She will purchase basic grains, oil, bread, shampoo, detergents, and cookies among other products that her customers request from her.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, oil, bread, shampoo, detergents, and cookies among other products that her customers request from her.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 57 years old, married, and has two children. 

Carmencita owns and operates a business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for six years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from it. In 2008, Carmencita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. 

Carmencita is requesting a new loan of 3,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely is from Alindahaw, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 38 years old and married with four children. Mely sells fish for their living and been in her business for eight years. She earns 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Mely joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Mely is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un padre de familia muy responsable de 54 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos la casa en la que viven es propia y esta ubicada en un caserío rural de nombre “El Horcon” el mismo que pertenece al distrito de Túcume en el departamento de Lambayeque, donde sus pobladores normalmente son comerciantes de productos agrícolas.

Su actividad económica desde muchos atrás a la que se dedica Manuel es a la crianza y comercialización de animales como ganado ovino, caprino y vacuno y en su mayoría son aves de corral, esta actividad ha llevado a Manuel hacerse muy conocido en su caserío pues es proveedor de los mercados de los caseríos aledaños al suyo, en esta actividad ya cuenta con una experiencia de 5 años, los cuales ha sabido manejar su negocio y ha podido ser el sustento de su familia.

Ahora Manuel necesita comprar alimentos balanceados para su ganado el cual desea darle un mejor engorde y un mas rápido crecimiento por lo que esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2000 Nuevos Soles los cuales ayudaran a cumplir con sus objetivos, con el fin de mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel is a responsible father who is 54 years of age. He lives with his wife and three children in their own home that is located in the rural village named "El Horcon", which is part of the District of Túcume in the Department of Lambayeque. Most of the villagers are merchants who sell agricultural products.

For quite some time, Manuel has been in the business of raising and selling animals such as sheep, goats, and cattle. However, he mostly raises poultry. This business has allowed him to become well-known in his village as a provider to the markets in the surrounding areas. Manuel has five years of experience and knows how to manage his business as well as support his family.

At the moment, Manuel needs to buy balanced feed for his livestock so that they will gain more weight and grow rapidly. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN to help achieve his goals and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Fidelina

texts.es:
La señora Fidelina, se dedica a su negocio Venta de Ropa Nueva como ser, Camisas, pantalones, ropa para niños, calcetines ,blúmer y variedad de mercadería todo lo que le pidan sus clientes, cuenta con 04 años de experiencia y lo realiza de manera ambulante en los barrios y colonias, tiene 65 años de edad y es una persona muy trabajadora que le gusta mucho lo que hace, esta casada y junto con su esposo han logrado Salir adelante.

Esta solicitando crédito por la cantidad de L. 10,000.00, el que va invertir en la compra de mercadería para su negocio y de esta manera poder ofrecer mas variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. Fidelina has a business of selling new clothing such as shirts, trousers, children's garments, socks, bloomers, and a variety of other merchandise that her customers request. She has four years of experience and conducts her sales by traveling to various neighborhoods and subdivisions. Fidelina is 65 years old and a hardworking individual who enjoys what she does. She is married and is able to move forward along with her husband.

Fidelina is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 HNL to invest in merchandise for her business so that she can offer more variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Reina se dedica a su negocio Compra y venta de ropa usada como ser, camisas, pantalones, blusas, faldas, vestidos, ropa de niño entre otros, ella sale a realizar sus compras al mercado dos veces por semana y sus ventas son de manera ambulante en los barrios y colonias de la ciudad,  tiene muchos clientes que le hacen encargos, es muy luchadora y disfruta mucha lo que hace, cuenta con la ayuda de su hija quien también la acompaña, tiene mas de 20 años de dedicarse a este negocio.
Esta solicitando crédito por la cantidad de L. 5,000.00 para poder invertirlo en la compra de variedad de ropa, su sueño es poder tener un local grande donde pueda vender su mercadería, espera que Prisma le apoye.
texts.en: Reina works in her business of buying and selling used clothing of all types, including shirts, pants, blouses, skirts, dresses, children's clothing and more. She goes to the market twice a week to buy her goods. Her sales are door to door in the neighborhoods and housing developments of the city. She has many clients who place orders with her. She is very determined and enjoys her work. She has the help of her daughter who accompanies her. Reina has been working in her business for more than 20 years. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 Honduras Lempiras (HNL) to invest in the purchase of a variety of clothing. Her dream is to be able to have a large shop where she can sell her merchandise. She hopes that Kiva's partner, Prisma, supports her.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her used clothing business.

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely is a married woman with two children. She is 39 years old and resides at San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Mely owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She has been in this business for seven years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase additional products to sell. 

In 2011, Mely joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, she wants to build a house and to finish the studies of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 39 years old. Nancy is married and has two children. 

To make a living, Nancy is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home-used products in the local community. She has been in her business for seven years and earns 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Nancy is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. 

In 2008, Nancy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Rea

texts.en:
Rea works hard to support her family. She is single and has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines.

Rea requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and other groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Rea would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and other groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Maria tiene 52 años de edad, es casada y vive con dos hijos mayores de edad quienes son económicamente independientes, tiene casa propia y esta ubicada en el un caserío rural pequeño de nombre “Fanupe Barrio Nuevo” el cual esta a unos escasos minutos del Distrito de Morrope y el mismo que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque.

Desde hace 20 años atrás Maria se dedica a la crianza, engorde y comercialización de ganado como ovinos, caprinos, y aves de corral para lo que ha construido corrales en la parte posterior de su casa, en el que se dedica todos los días a su alimentación y ponerlos en su peso y tamaño ideal para poder ofrecerlo a sus clientes que están en caseríos cercanos al suyo o a comerciantes de los mercados locales.. Su esposo es trabajador de campo como jornalero, apoyando con ingresos semanales para la canasta familiar.
 
Maria esta solicitando un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2000 Nuevos Soles con los cuales comprará alimentos balanceados con los que ayudará al crecimiento de sus animales y así poder ponerlos a mejor precio, con las utilidades que obtenga le permitirá asumir sus responsabilidad por el crédito y mejorará sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 52, married, and lives with her two adult children, who are economically independent. She has her own house, located in a small rural settlement called "Fanupe Barrio Nuevo," a few short minutes from Morrope district, which is part of Lambayeque province. 

For the last 20 years, Maria has been raising, fattening, and selling livestock such as sheep, goats and poultry. For this purpose she has built enclosures behind her house, where she works every day, feeding them and getting them to the ideal weight and size. This is so that she can sell them to her customers who are in settlements close to hers, or to buyers in the local markets. Her husband works in the fields as a day laborer, supporting the family's household income with his weekly wages.


Maria is applying for a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa, that she will use to buy balanced feed. This will assist her animals' growth, and enable her to sell them at a better price. The profits she gets will allow her to fulfill her responsibilites for the loan, and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed.

loans.name: Fausta

texts.es: La socia continua con la atencion de su cabina de internet y ahora desea el credito para poder comprar accesorios y otra parte es para invertir en la compra de mantas tipicas para implementar su negocio de venta de artesania en especial textiles.
texts.en: Fausta continues to tend to her internet cafe and she would now like a loan with which she can buy accessories for the internet center and also invest in the purchase of locally made blankets in order to start a line of business selling handmade craft items, especially textiles.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of handmade local blankets to sell in her internet cafe, and in the purchase of accessories for the internet cafe.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is an entrepreneur from San Miguel, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store business where she sells items like soft drinks, eggs, coffee, and canned goods. Juana is also a rice retailer. She is able to buy her family's basic needs with her income.

Juana is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell such as rice, dry goods, and soft drinks. She hopes for her business to grow bigger so she could extend help to her relatives and friends.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as rice, dry goods, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Rahbaroy

texts.ru: Рахбарой кредитор в организации с 2009 года, она раньше работала в местной поликлинике медсестрой, но из-за минимальной оплаты решила уйти и занятся своим делом, она год назад открыла свой ларёк, по продаже продуктов питания и хозяйственных товаров первой необходимости людей.Её муж мастер по ремонту квартир, поэтому помог ей по оформлению и пристройке полок для оформления магазинчика и укладки товаров. Она рада, что смогла с помощью кредитов открыть и расширить товарооборот. На очередной кредит она хочет закупить напитки и холодильник по продаже мороженого.
texts.en: Rahbaroy has been a client in the organization since 2009. She previously worked as a nurse at a local clinic. However, the salary at a clinic was so low that Rahbaroy decided to quit and started her business instead. One year ago, she started selling food and household goods in her own stall. Rahbaroy's husband is an apartment repair man. He hung shelves in the stall to display the items and helped Rahbaroy settle down. Rahbaroy is glad that the loans helped her increase the turnover. She would like to purchase beverages and an ice-cream freezer with another loan.

loans.use: to expand her food sales business

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is single, 21 years old, and resides at Bayabas, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.

Rolando is operating a business selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community to earn a living. He has been in this business for two years. Each month, he earns PHP 5,600 doing this type of business.

He requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional snack items to sell. Rolando has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Rolando wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional snack items to sell.

loans.name: Bakbubu

texts.ru:
Бакбубу 60 лет, замужем, воспитала шестерых детей.  В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи,  с 2000 Бакбубу занимается животноводством и полеводством. Стартовав с покупки 5 голов овец на сумму 30,000 сом (KGS),  Бакбубу смогла развить хозяйство численностью в 2 дойной коровы, 3 нетели, 3 теленка, 5 коз и 1 лошади. Также Бакбубу возделывает 2,40 га земли, где выращивает фасоль и картофель.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бакбубу обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков и дойной коровы. Доходы Бакбубу планирует вложить в покупку стройматериалов для постройки  большого удобного сарая для скота.
texts.en:
Bakbubu is 60 years old, married, and raised six children. The main source of income for Bakbubu and her family is animal husbandry and crop-farming, which Bakbubu has been engaged in since 2000. She started her business with the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) and bought 5 head of sheep. Throughout the years Bakbubu managed to expand the business, which today counts 2 dairy cows, 3 heifers, 3 calves, 5 goats and 1 horse. Bakbubu also cultivates 2.40 ha of land where grows beans and potatoes.
In order to further develop her business, Bakbubu turned to the organization Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase bull calves and a dairy cow. Bakbubu is planning on investing the earnings from the loan in building materials for the construction of a spacious and cosy cattle barn.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es un joven de 22 años que siempre ha buscado la mejor de manera de salir adelante y mejorar constantemente los ingresos que tiene. Actualmente el vive en la ciudad de Ica, lugar que se ha desarrollado económicamente en estos últimos años, el mismo que ha permito que los medios de transporte generen mayor cantidad de ingresos por la gran cantidad de personas que ahora tienen la necesidad de visitar distintos lugares.

Actualmente Pedro tiene dos negocios, el primero en el que es chofer de taxi y trabaja un promedio de 12 horas diarias, tiempo en el que atiende a 50 clientes, él también posee otro negocio el mismo que consiste en la crianza y venta de pavos, chanchos y pollo.

Con la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva el desea poder comprar alimentos para sus pavos y medicina para los mismos debido a que corriendo se chocaron con un árbol de tuna y las espinas de la misma los han dañado. Pedro está muy contento con la ayuda que le podrán brindar, desea continuar superándose y así lograr la compra de más animales para que luego cuando haya ahorrado el dinero suficiente pueda tener un taller de automóviles propio, negocio que él considera muy rentable.
texts.en:
Pedro is a young man of 22 who has always looked for the best way to make progress in life and constantly improve his income.  He currently lives in the city of Ica.  This is a city which has developed economically over the last few years, which has allowed people who provide transportation services to make more income owing to the large number of people who now need to travel to different places.  

Pedro currently has two businesses.  He is a taxi driver, working an average of 12 hours a day and serving up to 50 customers.  He also has another business raising and selling turkeys, pigs and chickens.

With the help of Kiva lenders, Pedro would like to buy feed and medicine for his turkeys because when they were running around they ran into a prickly pear plant and got hurt on the spines.  Pedro is very happy with the help that he will receive.  He would like to continue doing well and purchase more animals.  Later, when he has saved up enough money, he will open his own auto repair shop, a business that he believes to be very profitable.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for his turkeys

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es: La socia continua con su negocio de elaboración de comidas caseras la socia a mejorado sus platos y ya esta pensando en ampliar su negocio porque tiene mas clientela, ella tambien continua simultaneamente vendiendo quesos, chocolates, café, La socia desea en esta ocasion invertir el prestamo en la compra de productos al por mayor como arroz, fideos, sal, aceite, quesos, cafe entre otros productos para implementar su negocio y mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
This member is continuing her business preparing home-cooked meals.  The member has improved her dishes and is already thinking of growing her business because she has more customers.  She is also continuing to simultaneously sell cheese, chocolates, and coffee.

On this occasion, the member wants to invest the loan in the purchase of products at wholesale, such as rice, noodles, salt, oil, cheese, and coffee among other products to stock up her business and improve her sales.

loans.use: to purchase products at wholesale, such as rice, noodles, salt, oil, cheese, and coffee among other products to stock up her business and improve her sales.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijo, cuenta con casa propia en la que vive junto a su familia, su casa esta ubicada en un pequeño caserío rural de nombre “Palominos” perteneciente al distrito de Tambogrande en la provincia de Piura. Por ser un caserío pequeño por ahora solo cuenta con el servicio de energía eléctrica.

Su actividad económica de Bertha desde hace tres años atrás es dedicarse a la venta de productos de primera necesidad (Bodega) en su propio domicilio, negocio el cual maneja todos los días de la semana pues ya sus clientes la buscan por la buena atención y confianza que genera al momento de atender, junto a su esposo se han planteado objetivos los cuales den como resultado encontrar mejores oportunidades educativas para sus hijos, los dos se apoyan en sus diferentes actividades económicas. Adicionalmente ella también cría y comercializa aves de corral en la parte posterior de su casa los cuales los ofrece en diferentes mercados de la zona.

Bertha desea invertir en su Bodega por que considera que a un tiene demanda que satisfacer, por lo que esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1000 Nuevos Soles con los cuales comprará más productos de primera necesidad con los cuales pueda surtir mejor su negocio.
Es una persona responsable y conocida en nuestra institución debido que ha cumplido con puntualidad sus créditos anteriores.
texts.en:
Bertha is 34 years old, married, and has three children. She has her own home where she lives with her family. Her house is located in a small rural village named "Palominos", which is part of the District of Tambogrande in Piura Province. For being such a small village, it now receives electricity as its only service.

For the past three years, Bertha has been selling basic necessities from her own store in her home. She manages this business every day of the week since her customers are looking for good service and trustworthiness at the time they make their purchases. Bertha and her husband have made many plans together, such as providing better educational opportunities for their children. The two of them support their family through different businesses. In addition, Bertha raises and sells poultry in an area behind her house and offers the animals to different markets in the area.

Bertha wants to invest in her store since there is demand that she must satisfy. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN so that she can buy more basic necessities to restock her business. She is a responsible person who is known by Edpyme Alternativa as someone who completed her previous loans promptly.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to restock her business.

loans.name: Ana Gilma

texts.es:
Ana, vive con sus padres, es madre soltera de un niño de tres años, ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, trabaja en su casa, su familia la apoya, ella crece los cerdos y luego los ofrece a la venta.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de concentrado, para alimentar a los cerdos, este préstamo le ayudara para mantener la granja bien alimentada y poder salir con las ventas.
Ella quiere ayudar a su familia a través del negocio, logrando buenas ganancias, sacando adelante a su hijo para darle un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her parents. She is the single mother of a 3 year old boy. She works raising pigs. She works at home; her family supports her. She raises the pigs and later offers them for sale.

She is applying for a loan with which to buy pig feed in order to raise the pigs. The loan will help her keep the herd well fed and to be able to get her sales. She wants to help her family through the business, achieving good earnings and moving ahead in order to give her son a better future.

loans.use: To buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Cristo Salva 2 Group

texts.en:
Rosa is the coordinator of the Cristo Salva Group 2. Her family is made up of five children and her long-term partner. Her most difficult challenge has been to raise her children, in a Batey (sugar workers' town), because the opportunities for them are not the same as if they were able to study in a main city. She wants to have her house and a stable business, to save and live a tranquil and safe life.

Rosa is very excited to receive her four loan through Esperanza International. She took her first loan around two years ago, and after receiving these loans she has been able to make investments in her small business.

Rosa has a Colmado, this is a small food market, where neighbors go to buy their daily meal, She will invest this loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, flour, and other goods. Rosa dreams of having a safe house and a successful business. 

This group is composed of five Haitian immigrants located in the city of La Romana, where tourists and sugarcane are the biggest industries. They all live in a rural area called Batey, surrounded by sugarcane fields.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, and flour.

loans.name: Unidas Por Siempre Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Unidas Por Siempre” es un grupo que está conformado por 08 socias que llevan 04 meses trabajando con el Programa- Prosperidad, siendo Yanina una de las integrantes, ella tiene 39 años de edad es separada con 02 hijos aún dependientes. Hace más de 15 años que Yanina se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, con esfuerzo pudo habilitar un espacio en su vivienda, la cual le  permite  exhibir  sus prendas, a medida que fue pasando el tiempo ha mejorado su negocio, pues a complementado su negocio ofreciendo   productos de belleza. Yanina está orgullosa pues con su esfuerzo a podido ayudar a sus hijos con sus estudios y mejorar su vivienda. Con el fin de seguir mejorando solicito el crédito para invertir en su negocio comprando polos, shores, faldas y  productos de belleza como perfumes, talcos, cremas, etc. Y de esta manera tener que ofrecer a sus clientes. El deseo de Yanina es de seguir creciendo en su negocio. La Alcancía Comunal “Unidas Por Siempre” están agradecidos por la ayuda brindada ya que hacen posible su progreso.   Yanina está ubicada en la parte posterior, al centro, ella viste una blusa a cuadros color marón.
texts.en:
The 'Unidas Por Siempre' community bank is a group with eight members who have been working within the Prosperidad program for four months.

Yanina is a member of this group.  She is 39 years old, separated, and has two dependent children.  Yanina has been selling clothing for more than 15 years.  With some effort, she was able to set up a space in her home where she can display her garments.  Over time, she has improved her business and started selling beauty products as well.  Yanina is proud because, through her hard work, she has been able to help her children in their studies and improve their home.

With the aim of continuing to make progress, Yanina has requested a loan to invest in her business buying polo shirts, shorts, skirts and beauty products such as perfume, talcum powder, creams, etc.  This will give her more products to offer her customers.  Yanina's wish is to continue growing in her business.  The 'Unidas Por Siempre' community bank are grateful for the help that they are being given as it will enable them to make progress. In the photo, Yanina is in the back row, in the center.  She is wearing a brown, checkered blouse.

loans.use: to buy polo shirts, shorts, skirts, perfume, talcum powder and creams

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es:
El señor Adrian vive se dedica a la Compra y Venta de ganado con una experiencia de diez años en este negocio, le gusta mucho lo que hace ya que siempre ha vivido en el campo, el mismo se encarga de cuidar y alimentar el ganado, los clientes llegan a comprarle hasta la aldea donde vive porque ya lo conocen y les ofrece buen precio y calidad. Esta casado y tiene dos hijos,  gracias a los ingresos que ha obtenido de este negocio ha logrado mantener a su familia.
Esta solicitando crédito por la cantidad de L. 10,000.00 para la compra de ganado, ya que su sueño es que su negocio crezca y poder obtener mayores ingresos para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia, espera que Prisma le pueda apoyar.
texts.en:
Adrian's business is buying and selling cattle.  He has ten years experience in this business.  He really enjoys what he does as he has always lived in the countryside.  Adrian himself cares for and feeds his cattle.  His customers come to his small village to buy from him because they already know him and he offers them good quality at a good price.  Adrian is married and has two children.  Thanks to the income he makes in his business, he has been able to support his family.

Adrian is requesting a loan for 10,000 lempiras to buy cattle as his dream is to grow his business and make more income so that he can improve his family's living conditions.  He hopes that Prisma can support him.

loans.use: to buy cattle for his business

loans.name: Maripa

texts.ru: Марипе 34 года, замужем, воспитывает одного сына.  В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи,  с 2010 года Марипа занимается животноводством. Стартовав с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS), Марипа смогла развить хозяйство численностью в 2 дойной коровы, 8 овец и 1 лошадь. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Марипа обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку жеребят. Доходы Марипа планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение погловья.
texts.en: Maripa is 34 years old, married and raising one son. She has been involved in animal husbandry since 2010 to provide the main source of income for her family.  Having started with an initial sum of 10,000 som (KGS), Maripa was able to develop her business to have two dairy cows, eight sheep and one horse.  In order to further develop her business, she requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy foals. Maripa plans to invest the earnings into increasing livestock headcount further.

loans.use: to purchase foals

loans.name: Jenik

texts.en: Jenik is from the village of Akhouryan in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is married with two children: a twenty-one-year-old daughter and a sixteen-year-old son.  Jenik has a high school education, five years of work experience in retail trade and seventeen years of experience as a farmer.  She hopes that both of her children will graduate from university, live happy lives and find great partners.  Jenik is looking for a loan to purchase livestock and to restock inventory for her retail trade business.  She expects her income to increase by twenty-five percent with the investment.  Jenik plans to save some of the proceeds to complete the remodeling of the family home.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an oven, cake tins, etc.

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en: Alvard is from the village of Tsoghamarg in the Shirak region of Armenia. She is married with three children: a thirty-year-old daughter and two sons (ages thirty-four and thirty-six). She has a college degree in veterinary science and has been a full-time farmer for the past twenty years. She also helps her children's families with produce grown on her farm. Alvard is honest and hardworking. She wants to expand her business and is looking for a loan to purchase wheat and barley seeds. Alvard expects this investment to increase her income by twenty percent. She is pleased with the loan services and has a positive opinion of microfinance.

loans.use: to purchase seeds.

loans.name: Maria Edi

texts.es: La socia continua con el cuidado a una anciana y tambien continua con la fabricación de buzos en su taller de confección, la socia es una mujer muy emprendedora y le esta saliendo muy bien el negocio y ahora esta tratando de invertir todo su tiempo en la confeccion de buzoz asi que tal vez dejara de atender a la anciana, la socia tiene muchos sueños de crecer y ser prospera y en esta ocasion desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de telas, cierres, hilos entre otros para continuar fabricando buzos al por mayor.
texts.en: Maria Edi continues caring for an elderly woman and also continues to make sports clothing in her tailoring shop. She is a very enterprising woman and the business is going very well for her. Now she is seeking to invest all of her time making the sportswear, and to perhaps stop caring for the elderly woman. She has lots of dreams of growing and becoming prosperous. Right now she would like to invest the loan in the purchase of fabrics, closures, and thread among other items, so that she can continue to make the sports clothing in wholesale quantities.

loans.use: To invest the loan in the purchase of fabrics, closures, thread and other items in order to continue making sports clothing in wholesale quantities.

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
Edilberto tiene 43 años de edad, es casado y tiene 1 hijo con el que vive junto a su esposa, tiene casa propia la cual esta ubicada en el distrito de Zaña perteneciente a la provincia de Chiclayo, es una comunidad en la que normalmente los habitantes se dedican al comercio de ganado.

Actualmente se dedica a la crianza, engorde y comercialización de ganado como vacunos, ovinos entre otros, adicionalmente también negocia la leche que obtiene de sus vacas, la cual ofrece recorriendo los caseríos cercanos al suyo ya teniendo sus propios clientes a quienes les reparte de manera diaria.

Esta solicitando un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2000 Nuevos Soles con el fin de comprar alimentos balanceados para el mejor engorde de su ganado el cual podría venderlos a mejor precio y producirán mas leche con lo que podría abastecer a todos sus clientes.
Cuenta con buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Edilberto is 43 years old, married, and has one child.  He lives together with his wife and child in their own home, in Zaña district, in Chiclayo province.  This is a community whose inhabitants normally work in the field of livestock raising.

Edilberto currently works raising, fattening and selling livestock such as cows, sheep, etc.  He also sells the milk that he gets from his cows.  He sells it in nearby villages and has customers who he delivers to every day.

Edilberto is requesting a loan for 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy nutritionally-balanced feed so that he can better fatten his animals.  This will mean he can sell them for a better price and they will produce more milk for him to sell to his customers.  Edilberto has good personal and work references from his neighbors.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally-balanced animal feed

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es: Domitila es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Huanca, tiene 56 años y 6 hijos, de los cuales sólo está a  cargo de dos. Domitila es socia de FINCA Perú por más de 10 años y se dedica a la venta de frutas y ropa en ferias. Domitila ha mejorado en su negocio, tiene más ingresos, y gracias a sus ahorros pudo educar a sus hijos y comprar una moto taxi que le permite tener mayores ingresos. La nueva meta de Domitila es ahorrar para construir su casa. El nuevo préstamo será inverido en comprar ropa para llevar a las ferias fuera de Ayacucho.
texts.en:
Domitila is a member of the Communal Bank "Señor de Huanca". She is 56 years old and has six children, but only two of them are under her care. Domitila has been a member of FINCA Peru for more than 10 years and earns her living by selling fruit and clothes at the fairs. She has been able to improve her business and earn more income. Thanks to her savings, she has been able to educate her children and purchase a motorcycle taxi in order to earn more income. Her latest goal is to save toward the construction of a house.

This new loan will be invested in clothing that she can take to the fairs outside of Ayacucho.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell at the fairs.

loans.name: Karen Anabel

texts.es: Karen es una mujer de 36 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de ropa su historia empezó por iniciativa propia deseaba vender algo y se inclino por la venta de ropa, su trabajo lo hace sola no tiene horario, tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, es soltera, no tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es incrementar mas su negocio con diferentes venta de ropa. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su venta de ropa y asi comprar camisas y jeans.
texts.en: Karen is a 36 year old woman who has great aspirations to prosper in her clothing business in the next few years. Her story began by her own initiative. She wanted to sell something and she liked the idea of going into clothing sales. She does all of the work herself, with no set hours. She has some difficulties to overcome, such as crime. She is single and does not have any children. Karen's most important dream is to grow her business by selling different varieties of clothing. For this reason, she wants this loan, so that she can buy jeans and shirts for her business.

loans.use: To buy shirts and jeans to sell.

loans.name: Yohana Lizbeth

texts.es:
Yohana es una mujer que constantemente ha deseado salir adelante por sus dos pequeños 1 de 3 y el mayor de 8, ella los cuida y ama mucho, en sus tiempos libres les canta junto a su guitarra, siente que es muy feliz con sus bebes y está dispuesta a dar todo sí para sacarlos adelante.

Actualmente ella se dedica a la venta de guitarras, charangos, flautas entre otros instrumentos musicales, ella trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Siempre se ha descrito como una mujer trabajadora y luchadora por sus hijos.

Con la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva desea realizar algunas compras en artículos musicales como flautas, las que son màs solicitadas por los clientes estudiantiles, debido a que ya se acerca la temporada escolar y desea estar lista para cuando los clientes se acerquen a su tienda por la compra de alguno de  sus productos. Sabe que con este apoyo logrará mejorar sus ingresos, desea también de ese modo incrementar la cantidad de sus clientes y a su vez esforzarse para darle todo lo necesario a sus dos pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Yohana is a woman who always wants to make progress in life for the sake of her two youngest who are 1 and 3, and her eldest who is 8.  She cares for her children and loves them a lot.  In her free time she sings to them whilst playing her guitar.  She is very happy with her babies and is ready to do everything she needs to in order to provide for them. 

Yohana currently works selling guitars, 'charangos' (small, five-stringed guitars), flutes and other musical instruments.  She works from 8.00am to 6.00pm.  She has always described herself as a tenacious woman who works hard for her children.

With the help of Kiva lenders, Yohana would like to buy some musical instruments such as flutes which are the instruments which are most requested by her student customers.  A new school year is approaching and she would like to be ready for when her customers come to her store to buy her products.  She knows that, with this support, she will manage to improve her income.  She hopes, in this way, to also increase her number of customers and to work hard so that she can provide her little ones with everything they need.

loans.use: to buy some instruments for the start of the new school year

loans.name: Tanya Estefany

texts.es: Tanya es una mujer de 23 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su artesanía de zapatos su historia empezó estudiando manualidades y supo hacer zapatillas, su trabajo lo hace sola o con su suegra todos los días, tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, es casada, tiene2 hijos, su sueño más importante es comprar material para su elaboración de zapatillas. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su artesanía de zapatos.
texts.en:
Tanya is a 23-year-old woman who has a great desire to boost her sandal-making business over the next few years.

Tanya started out taking a craft course and learned how to make sandals.  She works alone or with her mother-in-law every day.  The difficulty she faces is crime.  Tanya is married and has two children.  Her biggest dream is to buy materials for making sandals.  She would like this loan for her sandal-making business.

loans.use: to make sandals

loans.name: Hitam

texts.en:
Hitam lives in northern Israel. Several years ago she began a bottle recycling business with family members. Hitam has decided to take her business and expand its ability to meet the demand in her village. Area restaurants, educational institutions and residents use her recycling services. With the extra income she will ensure economic security.

She needed this loan to purchase equipment for her storage shed and to have cash flow for business expenses.

In the future Hitam wants to develop her business so her monthly turnover will provide a secure income and enable her to save for the future.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for her storage shed and have cash flow for business expenses.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: El señor Alberto , es una persona trabajadora y responsable ya  que día  con día   se  preocupa  por  realizar  mejoras  en su  domicilio y brindar a su   familia  una  excelente  estabilidad, además  de  que  este  es  el  patrimonio de  sus  hijos,  es por  ello  que  en  esta  ocasión se  acerco  a la  institución   ya  que  desea  realizar    acabados  exteriores  en este,  tales  como   pintura porque con la que cuenta  actualmente  esta  muy  deteriorada, agradece  el apoyo  brindado para la realización de  su  proyecto.
texts.en: Señor Alberto is a hard-working and responsible man who day after day is concerned with making improvements to his home and giving his family an excellent stability, as this home is also the family estate going to his children. He came now to the microfinance institution Credituyo, because he wants to finish the work outside of the house, mainly repaint the walls that are in dire shape. Alberto is grateful for the provided support to carry out his project.

loans.use: to repaint his dwelling.

loans.name: Emilia Ebangelina

texts.es:
Emilia es una mujer de 54 años de edad, que continuamente está pendiente de poder salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida para sentirse no solo realizada si no una mujer feliz, su esposo también es un gran apoyo, el se dedica a la agricultura y juntos han demostrado que pueden salir juntos y apoyarse constantemente en lo que más necesitan. Actualmente ellos viven en la ciudad Nazca, destacada por su enormes lineas impregnadas en el suelo con formas de animales, algunos estudios especulan que estos fueron construidos hace muchos años.

Actualmente ella se dedica a la venta de productos naturales y también desayunos, trabaja un promedio de 8 horas diarias, tiempo en el que atiende a un promedio de 220 clientes, sabe que tiene mucha acogida por que siempre ha demostrado ser una mujer con dedicación que se empeña por atenderlos lo mejor posible.

Con ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, ella podrá ampliar un poco más negocio, comprar algunas cosas que le hacen falta y nuevos productos naturales para vender a sus clientes. Con este esfuerzo que dedique en los próximos años, ella está segura que saldrá adelante y podrá por fin tener muchos más locales para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Emilia is a 54-year-old woman who is constantly at the point of being able to get ahead and improve her quality of life, so she can feel not only completed but, even more, a happy woman. Her husband is also a great help. He dedicates his efforts to agriculture and together they have demonstrated that they can advance and continuously help themselves with what they most need. At present, they live in the city of Nazca, known for its enormous lines sketching animal forms impregnated in the soil. Studies speculate that they were constructed many centuries ago.

Now Emilia sells natural products and also breakfasts, working on average 8 hours daily, during which time she usually attends to some 220 customers. Emilia believes that she has attained much recognition by always demonstrating that she is a dedicated woman who strives to serve customers in the best manner possible.

With aid from Kiva investors, Emilia will be able to expand her business a little, and buy some thing she now lacks, plus new natural products to sell to her customers. With her efforts in the coming years, Emilia is certain she will get ahead and be able, finally, to have many more stands that sell her products.

loans.use: to buy new products to sell and to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional sheep for raising and resale during the holidays.

loans.name: Efaf

texts.en:
Due to issues of modesty, Efaf asked her son to be pictured with her camera. Efaf is a 39-year-old mother of four. Through a special training program in her community, Efaf has been trained in professional photography. She has been working as a freelance photographer with success. Current and potential customers in her neighborhood and surrounding area have requested Efaf to expand her services to include filming of special events, weddings and additional photographic services. After researching the potential of such an expansion and examining any existing competition, Efaf decided to make the investment.

She needed the loan to purchase additional equipment including a video camera, digital camera, lighting and CDs.

Efaf wants to continue and expand her business and one day open a photography studio.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment including a video camera, digital camera, lighting and CDs.

loans.name: Manuelito

texts.en: Manuelito is a 37-year-old married man with three children aged 6, 5 and 1. He has been in the business of seaweed farming for seven years and earns about PHP 5,000 per month. He works hard to make ends meet and hopes to start an additional business to augment his income and save for his children's education. Manuelito has requested a loan to buy seaweed seedlings, strings and wooden pegs. He hopes to have a larger income so he can send all of his children to school.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings, strings and wooden pegs.

loans.name: Marcos Joel

texts.es: Joel es un hombre de 20 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su arte de belleza "hace retratos en pinturas y diferentes oficios" su historia empezó hace 3 años trabaje con un señor que hacia arte de belleza y fui aprendiendo hasta que decidí hacerlo yo y empecé con mi lord, su trabajo lo hace con mi esposa y mi horario es de lunes a sábado, si tiene dificultades son la enfermedad, si está casado su esposa le ayuda ella es ama de casa, si tiene una hija de 1 año, su sueño más importante es tener un bazar muy grande. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para su arte de belleza.
texts.en: Joel, 20, has many aspirations. In the next few years, he’d like to prosper in his fine art business. Joel paints portraits and has other jobs. Three years ago he started working with an artist who made fine art and began learning from him until he decided that he would do it himself. Joel started out painting religious themes. He works from Monday to Saturday. If his illness causes him any difficulties, his wife helps him out. She is a housewife and takes care of their 1 year old. His big dream is to have a big bazaar. He is requesting the loan to invest in his fine art.

loans.use: buy tools and paints.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor tiene 55 años de edad es casado y no tiene hijos dependientes, cuenta con casa propia en la que viven y esta ubicada en un caserío pequeño rural de nombre “CP-12” perteneciente al distrito de de Tambogrande, y el mismo a la provincia de Piura, al norte del Departamento de Lambayeque. Su caserío es pequeño y por ahora solo cuenta con el servicio de energía eléctrica.

Su actividad económica de Leonor es dedicarse a la agricultura y ganadería simultáneamente, pues últimamente ha sembrado plantaciones de limón y mango a los cuales les da un mantenimiento diario, y los asiste con tecnología media, ha dicha actividad se viene dedicando ya un aproximado mas de 15 años atrás, adicionalmente su conyugue se dedica a la crianza, engorde y comercialización de ganado ovino y aves de corral en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales alimenta con pastos naturales de su caserío.

Su afán de seguir creciendo comercialmente, ahora esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1500 Nuevos Soles los cuales invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes para sus plantaciones y de alimento balanceado para su ganado el cual podría darle un mejor engorde y mas rápido crecimiento para ofrecerlos a mejor precio, y así obtener mayores utilidades con los que mejorara su calidad de vida.
 Conocemos de su alto grado de responsabilidad de Leonor por ser ya un cliente recurrente para
texts.en:
Leonor is 55 years old, married, and has no dependent children. He lives in his own home located in the small rural village named "CP-12", which is part of the District of Tambogrande in Piura Province and north of the Deparment of Lambayeque. This small village now receives electricity as its only service.

Leonor's business involves engaging in agriculture and livestock breeding simultaneously. His latest crops include lemons and mangoes, which he maintains on a daily basis through technical means. Leonor has been in this business for more than 15 years. In addition, his wife is in charge of raising, fattening, and selling sheep and poultry in an area behind their house. The animals feed on the natural grasses in their village.

Leonor's wish is to continue growing his business. He is now requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN so that he can invest in the purchase of fertilizers for his crops and balanced feed for his livestock. This will help the animals gain more weight and grow rapidly so that they can be offered at a better price. As a result, Leonor will earn more profits so that he can improve his quality of life. He is known for being highly responsible since he is a returning client.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam is 42 years old, married and has two children aged 8 and 5. She lives in Hingotanan, one of the islands in Bien Unido, Bohol. She earns a living by seaweed farming, and has grown and sold seaweed for 10 years. Miriam also runs a small sari-sari (or variety) store where she sells canned goods, toiletries and other products people use daily. Miriam works hard to support her family and be a responsible borrower. She is asking for a loan to buy seaweed seedlings and more items to sell at her store. This loan will help her grow her business.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings and items to sell at her store.

loans.name: Solidad

texts.en: Solidad is a 54-year-old married woman with five children aged from 18 and 27. She has been selling fish for 10 years and also makes dried fish to sell. She earns about PHP 4,000 from her business and works hard to support her family. She is planning to raise pigs to earn extra income. Solidad has requested a loan to buy 10 sacks of salt, two piglets and more fish to sell. She also wishes to open a mini grocery store and a more successful fishing business in the future.

loans.use: to buy salt, piglets and more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lizbeth Giannina

texts.es: Lizbeth es socia del Banco Comunal Ollantay y tiene 42 años. Lizbeth se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y es socia de FINCA Perú hace un año. Ella está agradecida a FINCA Perú porque ha aprendido a ahorrar y a ser más responsable. Lizbeth invertirá su nuevo préstamo en comprar más cosméticos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Lizbeth is a member of the Communal Bank "Ollantay" and is 42 years of age. She sells cosmetics and has been a member of FINCA Peru for one year. Lizbeth is grateful to FINCA Peru because she has learned how to save and be more responsible.

She invest her new loan in the purchase of more cosmetics for her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Yandri

texts.en:
Yandri is a 23-year-old man, who is married to Arni, a 22-year-old lady. They have a son, Jersy, one year old. Yandri is a fishmonger. When he graduated from Senior High school, Yandri tried to commence a business that is selling fish in a traditional market. He sells yellow mottled fish, sardines, etc.

Yandri wakes up early every morning then goes to buy fish directly from the fisherman to get a lower price. After that he goes to the traditional market to sell fish from 7.00 am until 7.00 pm.

Yandri intends to increase his income as his family needs are increasing. He wants to improve the business by purchasing more yellow mottled fish and selling them at the market. Therefore he is requesting a loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM.

loans.use: to purchase more yellow mottled fish for resale

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: Juanita is from Tagudalo, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 33 years old. Juanita is married and has two children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture, selling home used products. Juanita is now 2 years in business and earns 5,000 per month. In 2011, Juanita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Yakoba

texts.en:
Yakoba is a 52-year-old lady; she is married to Benyamin, a 62-year-old man. She has five children who are all married. They are: Agustina, 30; Selfia, 28; Ribka, 26; Yanti, 25; Andi, 23. All of her children live in their own homes, except Andi, who is still living with Yakoba. 

Yakoba has a tire repair business at home. Her husband and Andi assist her in running the business. The business is open from 7 am until 8 pm. Sometimes her husband has to serve customers even after 8 pm when the customer really needs assistance. 

Yakoba and family live in a rural area and she has a dream to improve the business by adding more business stock. She plans to purchase the stock once  a month to save time and money if she has enough capital to do. Therefore, Yakoba is requesting a loan of IDR 3,000,000 to buy tires, oil, spark plugs, etc. She is hoping that TLM will disburse the loan soon.

loans.use: to purchase tires, oil, spark plugs, etc.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en: Ricardo is married and has four children. He is 54 years old and lives in Romarate, Aurora, ZDS, Philippines. Ricardo used his last loan to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. His business is successful and he his taking a new loan to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. In the future he hopes to be able to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: Carlito

texts.en:
Carlito is married with four children and he is 53 years old, residing at Tagudalo, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.

Carlito is operating a gardening business venture just to earn a living and he has been two years in this business. Each month, he earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business.

He requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. In 2010, Carlito joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. In the future, Carlito wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies and to purchase another plot of farmland.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Casimera

texts.en:
Casimera is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She is 52 years old and is a married woman with 2 children. 

Casimera has been doing rice farming for more than 10 years. She works with her husband planting rice on their land. Casimera does her best to manage their business and to take care of her family. She also joined CEVI to assist them, financially, in their business. She is asking for a loan to purchase rice seeds and fertilizers. Casimera hopes to have her own capital in the future.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rainera

texts.en:
47-year-old Rainera is an entrepreneur from Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with five children aged between 21 and 8.

Rainera has been an AVON dealer for six years. She said that the secret to staying in this kind of business is hard work and patience. Rainera earns 6000 PHP per month with her business. She is requesting a loan to buy more AVON products to sell. Rainera hopes for her children to finish school and earn a degree.

loans.use: to buy more Avon products to sell

loans.name: Marjul Carmel

texts.en:
Marjul Carmel is from Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 22 years old and single.

To make a living, Marjul Carmel owns and operates a tricycle transport business (A tricycle is a bicycle with a passenger cab.).  Marjul Carmel has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Marjul Carmel is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchased a blender for additional business income.

In 2011, Marjul Carmel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and her living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a blender for additional business.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a married and has 6 children. Delia is 46 years old, and resides at Lapinig, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte, Philippines. Delia raises pigs and sells them to local community members to earn a living. She's been in this business for 2 years. Each month, she earns PHP3,000 doing this type of business. 

Delia has requested a loan of PHP6,000.00 to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. In 2009, Delia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and her living situation. In the future, Delia wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Ma. Vilma

texts.en:
41-year-old Ma. Vilma has been operating her sari-sari store business for 12 years. She sells items like bread, detergent soap, toiletries and other items. Ma. Vilma earns 3000 PHP per month with her business.

Ma. Vilma works hard to support her family: a husband and 3 children. Her husband works as a farmer. Ma. Vilma is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell such as rice, bread and canned goods. Ma. Vilma hopes for her family to experience progress in life.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as rice, bread and canned goods.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is a married woman who has six children. Genara is fifty-eight years old, and resides at Campo 1, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Genara raises pigs for sale to earn a living and she's been in this business for 25 years. Each month, she earns PHP 6,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000.00 to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. 

In 2007, Genara joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Genara wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Elpedio

texts.en:
Elpedio is a forty-eight-year-old married man with five children aged between twelve and twenty-one. He works as a farmer in San Miguel, Bohol. He primarily grows vegetables to sell. Elpedio earns about PHP 5,500 per month doing this farming. Elpedio works hard to improve his family's living situation.

Elpedio has requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other inputs. Elpedio plans to pay for his children's school fees with his profit.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other inputs.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is married and has 2 children. He is 27-years-old and lives in the Philippines.

Alex is operating a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for 5 years and every month he earn 5,000.00 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 10,000.00 PHP to repair his existing vehicle for better service.

Alex been a member of GDMPC since the year 2011. In the future, Alex hopes to fund the studies of his children and to gain double income out from his business.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service.

location.town: Campo 5, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is a married woman with 8 children. Her husband works as a farmer. Eufemia has had a sari-sari store business for 10 years. She sells canned sardines, shampoo, softdrinks and other items. Eufemia is able to provide for her family's daily needs with her income. She works hard to support her family. 

Eufemia is requesting for a loan of 6000 PHP to buy more items to sell such as softdrinks, rice and canned goods. She hopes for this loan to help expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as softdrinks, rice and canned goods.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Coiffeuse depuis 8 ans, Awa est âgée de 34 ans. Elle a ouvert un atelier ou elle fait de la prestation de service mais dispense aussi des cours de coiffure. Elle est aussi la présidente de l’association des coiffeuses  de la ville ou elle habite. Awa est une habituée  de la caisse car elle est à son troisième crédit. Avec le prêt  qu’elle demande, elle va acheter du matériel d’exploitation pour son salon : du greffage, des mèches, des produits cosmétiques dont elle se sert pour les maquillages et les coiffures. Elle paie la location et l’électricité à son atelier. Elle aimerait diversifier ses produits et services dans l’avenir et avoir une bonne assise dans son activité.
texts.en:
Awa is 34 years old, and has been a hairstylist for 8 years. She opened a shop where she offers services and also gives hair styling lessons. In addition, she is president of her local hair stylists association. 

Awa is a regular client of UIMCEC, and she is now on her third loan. With this loan, she is going to buy supplies for her salon: hair weaves, hair extensions, and beauty products that she will use for make up and hair styling.
