loans.use: to purchase the needed quantity of stainless tubes for his business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 25-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and one child. He’s the main income provider for the family and their only support. For this reason, he decided to have his own business, hoping to add some special changes in their life. 

After many years of experience as a barber, Ali opened his own barber shop in 2006. Today, he’s looking to borrow a youth loan, from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., to change his salon’s interior decoration and to purchase new barbering tools. In this way, he will be able to gain added clients and to improve his business. In the future, he plans to enlarge his salon and hire people to work with him.

loans.use: to change his salon’s interior decoration and to purchase new barbering tools.

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en: Kassem is a 22-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and three siblings who are all studying. Kassem’s father is the main income provider in the family and their only support. For this reason, Kassem decided to start his own business, hoping to help his father with their expenses. After two years of experience as a barber, he opened his own barber shop in 2009. He is now requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new barbering tools. In that way, he will be able to gain added clients and improve his business.  In the future, he plans to enlarge his salon and hire people to work with him.

loans.use: to purchase new barbering tools

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina is 51 years old and is married with ten children. Her husband works as a carpenter. For the past five years, she has run a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells items such as soy sauce, vinegar, biscuits, and canned goods. She earns about 5,000 PHP from her business and works hard to help provide for her family's needs.

Ludivina is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell such as rice and soft drinks. She hopes for her business to progress and improve.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as rice and softdrinks

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey used his previous loan to buy a heifer to rear. His major business challenges are price fluctuations and seasonal weather. 

Godfrey is requesting a loan to buy another heifer. His dream is to educate his children, buy a car, and own a ranch.

loans.use: to buy a heifer

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She works with her husband tilling their land and planting rice. Leonila has been a rice farmer for ten years. She is able to use the income she earns to help provide for her family. Leonila works hard to balance her time between farming and her family.

Leonila is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes that her loan will help increase her family’s harvest and income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and farm inputs

loans.name: Mirvate

texts.en:
Mirvate is a 23-year-old Lebanese woman. She lives with her husband and one school-aged child. She is working along with her husband to fulfill their family's needs. Mirvate has been working from her home as a tailor for the past three years . She also works as a wedding organizer and decorator.

Today, she is requesting a youth loan, from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, to purchase additional tailoring supplies such as textiles and some wedding planning supplies for her other business. This kiva loan will boost her productivity and also her revenues. In the future, she plans to open her own wedding planning company.

loans.use: to purchase textiles for tailoring and wedding planning supplies.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 24-year-old Lebanese married man who’s living with his wife and one child. He’s the one responsible for his family and looking to enhance their way of living. He has owned a pickup since 1999. He transports fruits and vegetables to the neighborhood shops. He works independently on a free-lance basis. 

Today, he wants to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to repair his pickup and perform the needed maintenance on it. This will certainly facilitate his business operations and develop his job. In the future, he plans to buy a bigger pickup and serve a wider range of customers.

loans.use: to repair his pickup and perform the needed maintenance on it.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en: Abbas is a 20-year-old man. He’s single and lives in Lebanon with his parents and seven siblings, one of whom is working.  He had many years of experience in the construction field; then he decided to work on his own and take on his own projects. He’s expert in his field and has gained a fair number of clients. Today, he needs to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase needed construction tools. This loan will facilitate his business operations and augment his revenues. In the future, he plans to attract more clients and take on bigger projects.

loans.use: to purchase needed construction tools

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 26-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and only one child. Unlike others his age, he works really hard just to give his family a respectable life. This pushes him to take on responsibilities and start to work early on his own. 

 Ali opened his own motorcycle repair shop in 2009 and still has it. Today, he’s asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase needed mechanical supplies for his business. He expects a fair increase in his profits, therefore his productivity. In the future, he plans to buy his own motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase needed mechanical supplies for his business

loans.name: Khvicha

texts.en:
Khvicha is a 45-year-old farmer from a small village in East Georgia. He lives with his family: his wife Shorena, three children (19, 17, and 12 years old), and his mother. His younger children go to school, and the elder one assists his parents in running the family farm, which is the main source of income for the family. They own five hectares of land, where they grow wheat, cabbage, tomatoes, garlic, and strawberries. The harvested products are sold locally to greengrocers. The family also owns three milk cows. Shorena produces cheese and sells it at the local market. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,000 Laris.

Khvicha requested a loan for financing planting season activities. In particular, he will pay a tractor owner to till his land and purchase fertilizer and vegetable seed. Khvicha hopes that the weather conditions will be favorable and the family will have a good harvest, which they can sell to increase the income of the family. 

Khvicha plans to save some money to renovate the family’s house, which is old and needs a make-over.

loans.use: to pay for land tilling services and purchase vegetable seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mirgul

texts.ru: Миргул 36 лет, замужем, воспитывает четырех детей.  В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи,  с 2001 года Миргул занимается животноводством. Стартовав с суммы в 2,000 сом (KGS), Миргул смогла развить хозяйство с ежемесячной прибылью в 2,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Миргул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы Миргул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья.
texts.en: Mirgul is 36 years old, she is married with four children. As a main source of income for her family Mirgul has been doing animal husbandry since 2001. Starting with the amount of 2,000 som (KGS) Mirgul was able to develop her business with a monthly profit of 2,000 som. In order to further develop her business Mirgul has come to Bai Tushim and Partners for a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock. Mirgul plans to invest the revenue from the loan in a further increase of headcount of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Jack

texts.en:
Jack is a 28-year-old, Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents. Jack’s father is trying his best to provide an appropriate life for his family. 

Jack has owned a mobile shop since 2010. He has more than a few ideas to develop his business. 

Today, Jack is looking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy additional mobile phones for his shop. This loan will help him attract more customers and therefore increase his sales. In the future, Jack plans to open a bigger shop to include additional supplies.

loans.use: to buy additional mobile phones for his shop.

loans.name: Enid

texts.en:
Enid used her previous loan to pay school fees for her children. In her business, she faces the problems of inadequate capital to purchase stock and the challenge of seasonal weather.

Enid is requesting a loan to pay school fees. Her dreams are to educate her children, build a permanent home and move her business to a permanent location.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 21-year-old Lebanese man who is engaged. He lives with his parent and two siblings, one of whom is working. Ali and his brother are responsible for covering their family's costs and expenses. 

Ali started his own business at an earlier age. He has owned an internet café since 2009. 

Today, Ali is requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to renovate his shop and purchase a new computer. This Kiva loan will boost his work and thus his profits. In the future, he plans to enlarge his shop and add more computers to it.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and purchase a new computer.

loans.name: Kymbat

texts.ru: Кымбат  39 лет, замужем, воспитывает четырех детей.  В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи,  с 2000 года Кымбат занимается животноводством. Стартовав с суммы в 3,000 сом (KGS), Кымбат смогла развить хозяйство с ежемесячной прибылью в 10,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кымбат обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы Кымбат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья.
texts.en: Kymbat is 39 years old, she is married with four children. As a main source of income for her family Kymbat has been doing animal husbandry since 2000. Starting with the amount of 3,000 som (KGS) Kymbat was able to develop her business with a monthly profit of 10,000 som. In order to further develop her business Kymbat has come to Bai Tushim and Partners for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock. Kymbat plans to invest the revenue from the loan in a further increase of headcount of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Pascale

texts.en:
Pascale is a 23-year-old Lebanese single woman. She lives with her parents and one working sibling. They’re all cooperating together to be able to cover their expenses. As for Pascale, she has been working as a private teacher since 2008 from her home. She’s intelligent, an expert in her field and sometimes visits her students at home. In parallel, she has been teaching in a local school.  

Today, she’s in need of a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase book shelves where she can place her documents in a proper way and have some privacy. In that way, she will be able to develop her method of communication with her students. In the future, she plans to focus on one job and have her own family and children.

loans.use: to purchase book shelves where she can place her documents in a proper way and have some privacy.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is  20 years old and single. He lives with his parents and two working siblings.  In 2010, he opened a clothing shop where he sells stylish, fashionable, and trendy clothes.

Hussein is requesting a youth loan from Ameen s.a.l., which he will use to purchase a new collection of clothes such as pants, scarves, t-shirts, and many other items. He notes that this loan will certainly push him to get higher returns. In the future, he plans to open other branches of his store.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of clothes such as pants, scarves, and t-shirts.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 30 years old and single. He lives with his one parent and sibling in addition to four other relatives. He has been working in wall foliage for the past six years. 

Mohammad is requesting a youth loan from Ameen s.a.l., which he will use to purchase added construction supplies for his business.  In the future, he plans to open his own wall foliage products shop.

loans.use: to purchase added construction supplies for his business.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en: Gertrude is a 52-year-old single mother living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has worked in agriculture for over fifteen years, and she started her business with her own savings. She faces problems like price fluctuations, customers not paying on time, and seasonal changes in weather. Her dream is to educate her children, build a permanent house, and buy land to grow crops. Gertrude needs this loan to finance her farm.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize for planting.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 40 years old and a single mother with three children. For the past four years, she has been in the business of renting out houses that she owns. This business is her main source of income. She started her business with savings from the salary of her previous job. Grace’s main business challenge is price fluctuations. 

Grace is requesting a loan to pay her children’s school fees. Her personal goal is to educate her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Las Nenas Group

texts.es:
Yolanda es una mujer muy entusiasta y alegre con ganas de sacar adelante a su familia ya que es su prioridad y a pesar de las adversidades que le aquejan ella está saliendo adelante con su negocio. Yola como de cariño le dicen sus amigas tiene 52 años de edad y es parte del grupo llamado “Las Nenas” dice que sus compañeras le pusieron ese nombre porque dice que todas las de su grupo se consideran mujeres guapas y con mucha vitalidad y sonríe doña Yolanda. Ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace 7 años y dice que la puso para tener un poco mas de ingresos para ayudar a su esposo. Dice que ahorita esta pasando por algo muy desagradable para ella ya que desde hace 8 meses empezó a perder su vista ya que tiene diabetes y es por eso que en unos días la operaran, platica que está un poco nerviosa pero que ella pide a Dios para que su operación salga bien ya que tiene cataratas. Dice que le urge el crédito que la harán por que quiere tener surtida su tienda ya que en varios días no podrá salir a la calle debido a la operación y así dedicarse por completo a su tienda ya que también los fines de semana vende antojitos mexicanos por la noche.  Dice que con el crédito comprara leche, huevo, azúcar, frijol, atún, sardina, aceite, jabón etc. Dice que uno de sus sueños es hacer crecer su negocio y tener un poco de todo para que la gente de su colonia no se traslade a otros lados a comprar los productos básicos. Ella está casada con el señor José Antonio el cual le ayuda con el negocio y tienen un hijo que estudia la preparatoria el cual tiene 18 años.
Las otras once integrantes del grupo se llaman Rosalba, Alma Yanet, Lizbeth, María Minerva, Gloria, Alicia, María del Socorro, Celia, Claudia Minerva, Alma Delia y Ma. Beatriz, ellas invertirán sus créditos para la compra de colchas, bolsas, antojitos mexicanos, dulces, frituras, jugos, zapatos por catalogo, surtir productos de belleza y perfumería, insumos para hacer paletas de hielo, ostionería, etc.
texts.en:
Yolanda, an enthusiastic and cheerful woman, wants to get her family ahead, and that is her priority despite the adversities that she has had moving her business forward. Yola, as her friends call her lovingly, is 52 and part of the group called “Las Nenas” (the Girls) She says that her companions chose this name because in this group all the women are thought to be pretty and lively and cheerful. She has had a grocery store for 7 years and she set it up to have a little more income to help her husband.
Now she tells us she is having problems because 8 months ago she started to lose her sight because of her diabetes and so she will have surgery in a few days.   She says that she is a little nervous but she prays to God that her operation will come out well since she needs to have the cataracts removed. She tells us that she badly needs the loan so that her store will be well supplied.   This is because there will be days when she can’t leave after the surgery and will then spend all her time in the store instead of going out to sell typical snack foods on weekend evenings.   She will use the loan to buy milk, eggs, sugar, beans, cans of tuna and sardines, oil, soap, etc.  One of her dreams is to expand her business and to have a little of many products so that the people in her neighborhood don’t have to travel to other areas to buy their staple items.  She is married to José Antonio and he helps her a lot with her business.  They have an 18-year old son who is in high school.

The other eleven members of the group are: Rosalba, Alma Yanet, Lizbeth, María Minerva, Gloria, Alicia, María del Socorro, Celia, Claudia Minerva, Alma Delia and  María  Beatriz.   They will use their loans to buy bedspreads, purses, typical snacks, sweets, fried foods, juices, shoes through catalogs and supplies of beauty products and perfumes, ingredients to make popsicles, oysters, etc.

loans.use: to buy items such as milk, eggs, sugar, beans, cans of tuna and sardines, oil, soap, etc

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 22-year-old Lebanese man. He’s single, living with his parents and two working siblings. He cooperates with his father to be able to satisfy their family needs. For this reason, he strives to work really hard and opened his own grocery shop in 2009. He has a wide variety of goods and products, also a fair number of loyal customers. 

Today, he wants to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added products for his shop such as soft drinks, dairy products and many other items. He notes that this loan will increase his sales therefore his profits and thus his revenues. In the future, he plans to open his own supermarket.

loans.use: to purchase added products for his shop such as soft drinks, dairy products and many other items

loans.name: Samira

texts.en: Samira is a 19-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and only one working sibling. Her father is the one supporting the family and bringing in income.  She has owned an accessories and gifts shop since 2010 in her town, where all the ladies can benefit from her products. Today, she has the intention to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy additional items for her shop such as necklaces, perfumes and many other items. She notes that this will bring her big profits. In the future, she plans to diversify her items and better develop her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items for her shop such as necklaces, perfumes and many other items

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 23-year-old Lebanese man. He’s single, living with his parents and three siblings. One of them is working and the others are still studying.  His father is the main source of income in his family and seeks to offer them a better future. 

Mohammad started to work as a salesman for a local company in 2009. Today, he’s looking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay his university fees. It’s his fourth year as a mechanical engineer and this loan will allow him achieve higher educational levels. In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans and pursue his Master’s degree.

loans.use: to pay his university fees

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 23-year-old single Lebanese man who lives with his parents and one sibling. His father is the one responsible for covering their costs and expenses. As for Hasan, he started his own business at an earlier age. He has been working in repairing computers since 2010, and he also sells some related accessories and spare parts. Today, he needs to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase added supplies for his business, such as cables, keyboards, and many other items. This Kiva loan will certainly increase his sales, and thus his profits. In the future, he plans to open his own computer shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies for his business, such as cables, keyboards, and many other items

loans.name: Daniel Javier

texts.es:
Daniel es un joven muy luchador y emprendedor, vive en el distrito de Parcona, Ica, Perú; el cual se caracteriza por uno sus atractivos turísticos el cual es el “Bosque de Piedras”, cuando Daniel dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta descansar y sobre todo comer uno de sus platos favoritos el “Ceviche”; el solo estudio hasta el cuarto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Ingeniería Mecánica.

Con mucho esfuerzo el desempeña su trabajo como chofer de taxi, durante 10 horas al día y puede transportar hasta 40 clientes, en algunas oportunidades Daniel trabaja como operario en una mina con lo cual tiene un dinero extra para cualquier emergencia, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy respetuoso con sus clientes y honrado.

Daniel está muy agradecido con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda que le han proporcionado el podrá reparar y realizar mantenimiento a su vehículo, lo que le permitirá tener un vehículo seguro para transportar a sus clientes y evitar tener algún tipo de accidente, con ello seguirá trabajando y podrá seguir luchando para cumplir su gran sueño:” Tener su flota de autos”.
texts.en:
Daniel is a very hardworking and enterprising young man. He lives in Parcona District, Ica, Perú, which is characterized by its tourist attractions such as the “Stone Forest.” When Daniel has free time, he enjoys resting and above all eating one of his favorite dishes, “Ceviche.” He only studied until the fourth level of secondary school but would have liked to study mechanical engineering.

With a great deal of effort, he works at his job as a taxi driver for 10 hours a day and can carry up to 40 customers.  On some occasions, Daniel works as a laborer in a mine so that he will have extra money for emergencies. He believes that his business is doing well because he is very respectful toward his clients, as well as honest.

Daniel is very grateful to Kiva lenders since, thanks to the help he has received he will be able to repair and do maintenance on his vehicle which will enable him to have a vehicle that is safe to carry customers and avoid having an accident. He will continue working and fighting to realize his great dream “to own a fleet of autos.”

loans.use: to do maintenance and make repairs on his vehicle.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is 44 years old and a married mother with five children. For over 20 years, she has been a farmer. Annet’s business challenges are seasonal weather variations and inadequate capital.

Annet is requesting a loan to buy seeds and to pay workers. Her personal goal is to educate her children and build a permanent house. She also hopes to diversify her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and pay laborers

loans.name: Sadik

texts.en:
Sadik is a hardworking married man. He and his wife have four children. For the past ten years, Sadik has been a farmer. His business challenge is price fluctuation.

Sadik is requesting a loan to clear land to farm. In the future, he hopes to educate his children.

loans.use: to clear land for farming

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Micheal is 28 years old and married. He lives in Hioma, Uganda. Micheal owns a motorcycle business that is locally known as a bodaboda. He bought his first motorcycle by saving his salary while working for British American Tobacco. Micheal’s major business challenge is price fluctuation. 

Micheal is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle. He hopes to expand his business into new markets, and hopes to buy another motorcycle and a car.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Martina

texts.es: Martina, de 36 años, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Alfredo de 36 años y sus 04 queridos hijos a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Martina, es una mujer hacendosa, se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos como también labora en sus campos de cultivo donde produce plantas de café. Hace 19 años que empezó con su trabajo y considera que lo más difícil es no ´poder combatir con las plagas y malezas que afectan sus siembras; pero aun así ella persiste con su trabajo ya que es la manera de poder solventar con los gastos de su hogar. Marita y su esposo se preocupan por la educación de sus hijos y desde muy temprano se dirigen a su parcela para que en los tiempos de cosecha obtenga buena producción. Desde que sus vecinos le hablaron sobre los préstamos de MFP no dudo en acoplarse para seguir con sus planes de trabajo. Este será su crédito número 01 con MFP, se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas de pago para que en otra oportunidad pueda acceder a otro crédito. En su banco comunal es una socia responsable. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará abono para mantener su producción de café.
texts.en: Martina, 36 years old, lives in her own house with her 36-year-old husband Alfredo and her four dear children, and she wants to provide her family with a better quality of life. Martina is a hardworking woman and she is dedicated to taking care of her children, as well as working in the fields to cultivate coffee plants. She began her work 19 years ago. The most difficult thing to combat is not being able to fight the pests and weeds that affect her crops, but yet she continues with her work since it is the way to deal with household expenses. Martina and her husband are concerned about their children’s education and early every morning they head to their plot of land so that during the harvest times they will obtain good production.  Ever since the neighbors talked to Martina about the MFP loans, she has not hesitated to take part in them in order to carry on with her work plans. This will be her first credit with MFP, and she has agreed to pay her loan repayments on time so that later she can receive another opportunity to access another credit. She is a responsible member of her community bank. With the $1,000 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency), she will buy fertilizer in order to maintain her coffee production.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia, de 42 años, vive en su propia casa junto a 05 queridos hijos y su esposo Arturo de 46 años, quien le apoya en los peores momentos. Eugenia, es una mujer cuya pasión, es labrar la tierra para luego cultivar plantas de café; su motivo por la cual realiza todo esta labor a para poder ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida para sus hijos. Eugenia, con la ayuda de su esposo lograron conseguir 05  hectáreas de café, hace 20 años y ahora les resulta ser muy productivas. Con el tiempo espera en obtener aun mas plantaciones de café ya que en las temporadas de cosecha le gratifican muy bien por sus frutos.  Con el crédito solicitado podrá realizar el mantenimiento de sus plantas. Este será su crédito número 06 con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con sus respectivas obligaciones de pago, además hace hincapié a su banco comunal por la veracidad y honestidad que tienen cada uno de los socios.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, invertirá en darle un mejoramiento de sus plantaciones de café, adquiriendo abonos e insumos, con la finalidad de mejorar su  producción.
texts.en:
Eugenia is 42 and lives in her own house with her five dear children and husband Arturo, 46, who supports her in the worst times. Eugenia is a woman whose passion is working the land in order to grow coffee plants. Her reason she does all this work is so that she can provide a better quality of life for her children. 

Eugenia managed with her husbands help, to acquire five hectares of coffee plantation 20 years ago, and now they are proving to be very productive. In time, she hopes to acquire even more coffee plantations, since at harvest time, they reward her very well with their crops.

With the loan applied for, she will be able to maintain her plantation. This will be her 6th loan with MFP, so she promises to meet her repayment obligations.

In addition, she emphasizes the value of communal bank, because of the truthfulness and honesty of each one of the members. 

With the 2,000 nuevos soles, she will invest in the improvement of her coffee plantings by buying fertilizers and agricultural supplies, with the aim of improving her production.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Quinto

texts.en:
Quinto is 52 years old. For the past ten years, he has been a farmer. He began on a subsistence level and later moved to commercial farming. Quinto’s business challenges are inadequate capital and high price fluctuations. 

Quinto is requesting a loan to buy seeds to plant. He wants to take advantage of the new planting season and expand his farm. Quinto’s personal goal is to educate his children and business-wise, he wishes to expand his business into new markets and diversify.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant

loans.name: Molly

texts.en:
Molly is 41 years old and is married with five children. She is a teacher by profession and has been teaching for 18 years. Molly’s financial challenge is that prices fluctuate and are high yet her salary does not increase at the same rate. 

Molly is requesting a loan to pay school fees for her children. Her personal goal is to educate her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is a 46-year-old married woman with five children between the ages of 11 and 19. She runs a fishing business with her husband, who is a fisherman. Bernadeth sells her husband's catch at their town's market and also makes dried fish to sell. She works hard to provide for her family's basic needs and to send her kids to school. 

Bernadeth is requesting a loan to buy fishing nets and other materials. She hopes to be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other materials

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Victor tiene 40 años y vive junto a su esposa, la cual lo apoya mucho con su negocio de Fotocopiadora y sus tres hijas cuyas edades comprenden 20, 19, 9 años en el distrito de la Tinguiña, Ica, Perú; es un distrito que se caracteriza por la amabilidad y alegría de sus pobladores, como buen peruano le gusta mucho la comida de nuestro país y es por ello que uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo combinado que se basa en Arroz con pollo mas Tallarines, con esfuerzo logro terminar su carrera de enfermería Técnica, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar contabilidad.

Todos los día el se esfuerza por realizar bien su trabajo como chofer de taxi, él le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 10 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 40 clientes al día, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque siempre atiende a los clientes con amabilidad y porque tiene mucha iniciativa.

Victor está muy agradecido con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le ha brindado, él podrá realizar una reparación y mantenimiento a su vehículo, así tendrá un vehículo en buen estado lo que le permitirá evitar accidentes y sus clientes tengan más confianza en utilizar sus servicios, así seguirá trabajando para cumplir su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a sus hijas”.
texts.en:
Victor is 40 years old and lives with his wife -an important support for his copying business- and their three daughters aged 20, 19 and 9. They live in the district of Tinguiña, Ica, Perú, characterized by the cheerfulness and kindness of its inhabitants. As a Peruvian, Victor likes Peruvian food very much. His favorite dish is rice with chicken and noodles. After a great effort he was able to graduate as a Technical Nurse, although he would have preferred to study accounting. 

Everyday Victor tries to excel at his job as cab driver. He works for approximately 10 hours a day, serving some 40 customers. He believes he does well in his business because he always approaches his customers with kindness and because he has initiative. 

Victor is very grateful with Kiva loaners because thanks to their support he will be able to maintain and repair his car, thus avoiding accidents and increasing the confidence among his clients. In this way, he will be able to keep on working in order to fulfill his greatest dream, which is to provide a professional education for his daughters.

loans.use: maintaining and repairing his vehicle

loans.name: Celestino

texts.es:
Celestino tiene 50 años, está casado con Dominga con quien tiene 2 hijos que ya son jóvenes. Ellos viven en su casa propia en el caserío de Cumutay, distrito de Huasahuasi. Cuando era joven empezó a dedicarse a la agricultura,  en la actualidad siembra papa, arvejas, maíz y flores de gladiolos en sus terrenos de cultivos. Le gusta mucho la labor de campo porque la realizan todos los miembros de su familia, aunque reconoce que la labor es sacrificada ya que debe vigilar todos sus cultivos, para que no se pierdan por las plagas o los factores climáticos adversos, de esta manera siente que su dedicación es recompensada durante el tiempo de cosecha, pues recoge toda su producción y la vende en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad a regulares precios. 
A la vez se encarga de la crianza de animales como vacas, toros, carneros, chanchos, que comercializa de vez en cuando en las ferias de la ciudad. Y como es un hombre emprendedor para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad, y también quiere comprar mas animales para continuar con la comercialización, ya que sabe que obtendrá generosas ganancias. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Lindo amanecer de Cumutay” y este sería su crédito número 10 con MFP, esta muy agradecido con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito. Además dice estar satisfecho con el desempeño de su grupo comunal porque esta integrado por personas muy responsables. Celestino de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero en la compra de bolsas de abonos orgánicos para sus plantaciones de flores de gladiolos.
texts.en:
Celestino is 50 years old.  He is married to Dominga, with whom he has two children who are still young.  They live in their own home in the village of Cumutay, which is in the district of Huasahuasi. 

When Celestino was young, he began working in agriculture.  He currently grows potatoes, peas, beans, corn, and gladioli flowers on his farmland.  He very much enjoys working in the fields, because so do all the members of his family.  However, he recognizes that this labor requires self-sacrifice and he must be vigilant over all his crops so that he doesn't lose them to pests or adverse weather conditions.  He feels that his dedication in this way is rewarded at harvest time, as he reaps all his production and sells it in the wholesale market in his city at standard prices.

At the same time, he also takes care of raising animals such as cows, bulls, rams, and pigs, which he sells from time to time at the city's markets.  And as an entrepreneurial man, in the future he has planned to sow a greater quantity of crops, and he also wants to purchase more animals to continue with his animal sales, as he knows he will earn generous profits.

He belongs to the “Lindo Amanecer de Cumutay” ["Beautiful Dawn of Cumutay"] communal bank, and this will be his tenth loan with MFP.  He is very grateful to all the people who make the loan possible.  He also says that he is satisfied with the performance of his communal bank, because it is made up of very responsible people.

On receiving the help, Celestino will invest the money in the purchase of bags of organic manure for his gladioli flower plantations.

loans.use: to purchase organic manure.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 51 años. Está casado con Hilda, de 44 años, con quien tiene 6 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 de ellos: David de 14 y Verónica de 12 años. Su casa es propia y se ubica el caserío de Santa Clara, distrito de Huasahuasi – Tarma. Hace 30 años, Juan trabaja la tierra. La siembra de papa en sus diferentes variedades, es su principal actividad, pero no solo a eso se dedica Juan, ya que, la crianza intensiva de ganado vacuno y ovino; es lo que le divierte más; ya que le  ayudan a relajarse del arduo trabajo. Comenta que; los enseba y posteriormente vende su carne en pueblos vecinos o en la misma ciudad de Huasahuasi. Sus cultivos se encuentran en distintas partes; y ese es uno de sus inconvenientes, ya que las chacras están en varias lomas y montañas, que dificultan el normal desplazamiento o traslado de los sacos de papas para las ventas. Así también cultiva arvejas, porque las ventas son rentables. Gracias a su esfuerzo, en toda su vida como agricultor pudo y puede dar la adecuada mantención de su familia. Espera continuar con las mismas fuerzas y ganas para seguir trabajando en el campo, porque es, lo que le gusta hacer. Éste sería su crédito número 12 que obtendría de MFP, por eso menciona que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Trabajemos unidos”, y se siente cómodo tener compañeros solidarios y responsables.
Con el dinero podrá comprar 4 bolsas de semillas de arvejas, así también varias bolsas de abonos orgánicos, para fertilizar sus cultivos de papas y arvejas.
texts.en:
Juan is 51 years old. He is married to Hilda, 44 years old, and they have six children but only two live with them: David (14) and Verónica (12). The home is theirs and located in the village of Santa Clara, district of Huasahuasi – Tarma.

For 30 years Juan has worked the land. His primary work is planting different varieties of potato crops. But that’s not all that Juan does since intensive breeding of cattle and sheep is what he enjoys more as he finds hard work relaxing. He says that he fattens them up and later sells their meat to village neighbor in the city of Huasahuasi. His crops are in different areas, and that is one of his inconveniences since the ranches are in different hills and mountains that impede the normal movement or transfer of potato sacks to sell. He also grows peas because sales are profitable. 

Thanks to his effort, his whole life as a farmer he could and can support his family. He hopes to continue his current efforts and successes in order to continue working in the field because it’s what he likes to do. This will be his 12th loan that he’s gotten with MFP, and for that reason he mentions that he will be punctual in the repayment of the monthly terms. He belongs to the communal bank “Trabajemos Unidos” (We Work Together), and he feels comfortable having team-minded and responsible partners. 

With the money he will buy four sacks of pea seeds as well as a variety of sacks of organic fertilizers to fertilize his potato and pea crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 44 years old.  He is married and has six children.  

George is a teacher and has been teaching for 22 years.  The primary challenge he faces is high price fluctuations and his family’s goal is to educate their children. He intends to use this loan to pay school fees for his children.  He hopes to diversify into other businesses in the future.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 36-year old married man with four children living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda.  He owns a butcher shop and has worked for over six years.  He started by working in farming where he managed to earn his capital.  The two main hardships he faces are price fluctuation and seasonal weather.  His dream is to educate his children, buy a car, diversify the business and buy land to grow crops.  Richard needs this loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Sexto Sentido Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama "Sexto Sentido"  esta conformado por seis  integrantes hombres  y mujeres trabajadores  con deseos de mejorar sus vidas y hacer crecer sus negocios.
El representante del grupo es el señor Aureliano un señor trabajador amable con deseos de superarse y mejorar su vida y la de su familia.
Tiene  cincuenta y seis años de edad esta felizmente  casado con  la señora  Yolanda una señora trabajadora de  cincuenta años de edad, ellos tiene  tres hijos que  ya están casados y tiene  hijos.
El se dedica a la venta de  abarrotes desde hace cinco años vende lo que es : galletas,sabritas,leche ,pan,café,mayonesa,cereal,mermelada,refrescos,agua y azúcar.
El pidió el préstamo para la compra de líquidos y fertilizantes  para la venta y que sus paisanos tiene que ir a la localidad vecina a  comprar los líquidos y fertilizantes  ya que en su localidad no venden.
El nos cuenta que esta  muy contento por la ayuda que le ha dado fundacion para poder hacer mas grande su negocio y poder vender algo mas como son los fertilizantes.
Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
Irais-quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Galicia Alberta- quien se dedica a la venta de pescado.
Norberta Antonia-quien se dedica a la venta de abarrotes.
Angeles-quien se dedica a la venta de agua garrafón.
Nahum-quien se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres.
Le dan las gracias a fundacion por el apoyo que les ha dado para salir adelante y triunfar en la vida.
texts.en:
This group is called "Sexto Sentido" (“Sixth Sense”) and is made up of six members, men and women, who desire to improve their lives and make their businesses grow. Sr. Aureliano is the representative of the group. He is a friendly and hard worker with the desire to succeed and improve his life and that of his family.

Aureliano is fifty six years old and happily married to Sra. Yolanda, a hardworking woman of 50 years. They have three children who are now married and have children of their own.

He has been selling groceries for five years. He sells items such as cookies, chips, milk, bread, coffee, mayonnaise, cereal, marmalade, soft drinks, water and sugar. He requested the loan to buy liquid and solid fertilizers to sell because his countrymen have to go to a neighboring locality to buy these items since they are not sold in their area.

He tells us that he is very happy with the help provided him by the Fundación, which has enabled him to expand his business and sell something more, such as fertilizer.

The other members of the group are: Irais, who sells Mexican appetizers, Galicia Alberta who sells fish, Norberta Antonia who sells groceries, Angeles who sells bottled water, Nahum who sells fruits and vegetables. They all thank the Fundación for the support that has been given them to move ahead and triumph in life.

loans.use: to buy liquid and solid fertilizers to sell

loans.name: Crisalidas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Crisálidas esta conformado por  tres integrantes mujeres  trabajadoras con deseos de superación.
La representante del grupo es la señora  Josefina  de veinte ocho años de edad, esta felizmente casada con el señor  Tomas un señor trabajador y honesto con quien tiene  cuatro hijos Karen, Naideli, Nahomi y Benjamín.
Ella se dedica a la elaboración de comida desde hace  desde hace tres años, ella nos cuenta que lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es  darle un buen sazón a sus platillos.
Pidió el préstamo para más ingredientes para la elaboración de comida como es: jitomate, cebolla, ajo, verduras, queso, carnes frías, pescado y aceite.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son: 
Elvia-quien se dedica a la venta de perfumes.
Josefina-quien se dedica a la venta de  ropa.

Le dan las gracias a fundacion realidad por el apoyo que les ha brindado para salir adelante y triunfar en el futuro.
texts.en:
This communal bank is named Crisálidas. It is comprised of three members who are hardworking women with the wish to overcome.
The group leader ir 28-year-old Josefina. She's happily married to Tomas, a hardowrking and honest gentleman with whom she has four children - Karen, Naideli, Nahomi and Benjamín.
She has been making food for the past three years. She reporst that what she likes most about her business is to prepare well-seasoned dishes.
She requested the loan so that she can buy more ingredients for making food, such as tomatoes, onions, garlic, vegetables, cheese, cold cuts, fish and olive oil.
The other members of the group are Elvia, who sells perfumes, and Josefina, who sells clothing.
They give thanks to Fundación Realidad for the support they have been given in order to get ahead and succeed in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making food.

loans.name: Asiimwe

texts.en: Asiimwe used the previous loan to buy clothes to sell.  In her business, she faces two main hardships -- price fluctuations and inflation.  Her dream is to educate her children and diversify her business.   Asiimwe needs this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: San Pedro Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama San Pedro  esta integrado por  cuatro personas con deseos de hacer crecer sus negocios y mejorar la vida de sus familias.
La representante de este grupo es la señora Imelda una señora trabajadora y amable que se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y bolsas  para dama.
Doña Imelda  tiene cincuenta y dos años de edad, esta felizmente casada con el señor Eleuterio  con quien tiene  una hija que se llama Yadira.
Ella pidió el préstamo para  la compra  de más cosméticos y bolsas para dama.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Araceli – quien se dedica a la venta de pollos.
Beatriz-quien se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes.
Deonicia-quien se dedica a la venta de artesanias.

Le dan las gracias a fundacion por el apoyo que le ha dado para salir adelante y salir adelante y tener una mejo calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This communal bank is named San Pedro. It is comprised of four people who wish to expand their businesses and improve their families' lives.
This group's leader is Imelda, a kind and hardworking woman who sells cosmetics and ladies' purses.
Imelda is 50 years old and happily married to Eleuterio, with whom she has a daughter named Yadira.
She requested the loan in order to purchase more cosmetics and ladies' purses.
The other members of the group are Araceli, who sells chickens; Beatriz, who sells groceries; and Deonicia, who sells crafts.
They give thanks to Fundación for the support they have been given in order to get ahead and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and ladies' purses for selling.

loans.name: Kalyskan

texts.ru: Калыскан 57 лет, вдова, проживает с семьей сына и воспитывает внучку. 25 лет назад, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи,  Калыскан начала свой бизнес в животноводстве. Стартовав с покупки лошади, Калыскан смогла развить хозяйство с ежемесячной прибылью в 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Калыскан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. В ближайшее время Калыскан планирует отправить внучку на учебу в специализированную музыкальную школу, так как девочка талантлива и мечтает стать музыкантом.
texts.en: Kalyskan is 57 years old, a widow, lives with her son's family and raises her granddaughter.  In search of a source of income for her family, Kalyskan started her own business in animal husbandry 25 years ago.  Starting with a purchase of a horse, she was able to develop her business to have a monthly profit of 15,000 som (KGS).  In order to continue developing her business, Kalyskan requested a loan in the sum of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase livestock.  In the near future, she plans to send her granddaughter to study at a specialized misc school because the girl is talented and dreams of becoming a musician.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Tifany Briseth

texts.es:
Tifany es una joven muy trabajadora y entusiasta tiene 18 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, El departamento de Ica es el único de la costa sur formado por planicies, también llamadas llanuras costeñas, puesto que la Cordillera de los Andes se levanta muy al interior. En Ica se encuentran extensos desiertos, como las Pampas de Lancha, las Pampas de Villacurí, en donde el calor es muy intenso, ofrece playas y aguas termales, variada fauna marina, museos de sitio y excelentes servicios de hoteles, a Tifany le gusta escuchar en sus tiempos libres, ya que le ayuda a descansar  y a distraerse un poco, ella estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, ´pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Derecho.

Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ella puedo iniciar su negocio de venta de artesanías, recuerdos, ropa y bebidas en uno de los lugares turísticos más visitados de la ciudad, le dedica alrededor de 5 horas al día y cuando son fechas festivas trabaja 8 horas  para poder tener una ganancia extra, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque la zona es muy visitada, además es muy amable con los turistas.

Tifany está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar más mercadería (recuerdos, artesanías, entre otros), así tendrá una mejor variedad de productos y podrá tener mayores ingresos, así seguirá trabajando y luchando para cumplir su más grande sueño:” Tener su Casa propia”.
texts.en:
Tifany is a hardwoking, enthusiastic 18-year-old woman. She lives in Ica, a province in southern Peru. In her leisure time, she likes listening to music because it helps her to rest a little. Although she only was able to complete fifth grade at high school, she would have liked to study Law. 

After much effort and dedication, Tifany was able to start her souvenir business in one of the most visited touristic places in town. She works there for 5 hours on normal days and 8 hours on holidays in order to make a greater profit. She considers her business to be successful because it is located in a very transited zone and because she’s very kind to tourists. 

Tifany is very grateful to Kiva loaners because thanks to their support she will be able to stock her business, offering more variety and receiving greater revenues. She will keep on working and struggling to achieve her greatest dream, which is to buy her own house.

loans.use: stock her business

loans.name: Paso De La Reyna Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Paso de la   Reyna  esta conformado por  cuatro personas trabajadoras humildes con deseos de mejorar sus vidas.
La representante de este grupo es la señora Rosa Maria una señora trabajadora humilde que se dedica a la venta de  antojitos mexicanos y a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes como es : mayonesa, chiles, jitomates, galletas, jamon, salchicha, leche, café, pan, dulces, refrescos, aceite, azucar, sal, papel higienico, detergenete y pasta dental.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de más mercancía de abarrotes  para la venta por mayoreo y menudeo.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son: 
Calixto –quien se dedica a la venta de ganado.
Miguel-quien se dedica a la venta de ganado.
Alberto-quien se dedica a la venta y elaboración de muebles de madera.
Todos están muy agradecidos por el préstamo que les dieron y quieren seguir luchando dia a dia para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This communal bank is named "Paso de la Reyna". It is comprised of four humble, hardworking people who wish to improve their lives.
This group's leader is Rosa Maria, a humble, hardworking lady. She sells antojitos (a typical Mexican snack) and groceries such as mayonnaise, beans, tomatoes, crackers, ham, sausage, milk, coffee, bread, sweets, refreshments, olive oil, sugar, salt, toilet paper, detergent and toothpaste.
She requested the loan in order to purchase more groceries for selling on wholesale and retail.
The other members of the group are Calixto, who sells cattle; Miguel, who sells cattle; and Alberto, who sells wooden furniture.
They are all very thankful for the loan they have gotten and they want to keep on striving to improve their living conditions everyday.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for selling.

loans.name: Aygul

texts.ru: Айгул  проживает в селе Атай на севере Кыргызстана со своей семьей с четырьмя детьми, младшему из которых один год. Как и многие семьи в сельской  местности, Айгул с мужем откармливают скот, начав этот бизнес еще 10 лет назад. На сегодняшний день, Айгул в своем хозяйстве имеет 3 головы дойных коров, 20 овец и 2 жеребенка, продажа молока, молочных продуктов и мяса позволяет получать около 7,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.  В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Айгул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма и  перепродажи.    Доходы Айгул планирует вложить в постройку сарая.
texts.en: Aygul lives in the Atay village in the northern Kyrgyzstan with her family of four children, the youngest of whom is one years old.  Just like many families in the rural area, Aygul and her husband fatten up livestock. after starting this business ten years ago.  Today, she has three heads of dairy cows, twenty sheep and two foals in her business.  The sales of milk, milk products and meat allow her to earn about 7,000 som (KGS) per month.  In order to further expand her business, Aygul requested a loan in the sum of 70,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy bulls for fattening up and resale.  She plans to invest the earnings into building a barn.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Originally from the Dominican Republic, Rosa now lives with her 16-year-old daughter in the Bronx, New York. She moved to the United States 20 years ago to attend school for business and accounting in hopes of one day owning her own business. Last year Rosa was able to fulfill this dream by establishing "RSJ Accounting Services", a home-based business that handles accounting, bookkeeping, payroll, and tax preparations for both businesses and individuals. In addition to this Rosa still maintains a part-time position with the Department of Education as a Human Resources Employee.  

Currently Rosa is the only person employed by RSJ, however before the end of the year she hopes to employ a bookkeeper and a tax preparer. Also this year, Rosa hopes to transform her home-based business into a larger one, that will be able to provide a CPA service, and move her business into an professional office. This loan will be used to purchase needed software, as well as office supplies, including new desks, chairs, and computers.

loans.use: to purchase needed software and office supplies and furniture.

loans.name: Grupo  Rio Viejo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Grupo  Rió Viejo esta conformado por seis  personas trabajadoras, alegres con ganas de superarse.
Uno de los integrantes de este grupo es el Joven Frumencio de  veinte tres años de edad, el nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de artículos de papelería como es: hojas tamaño carta, hojas tamaño oficio, fólder tamaño carta, hojas tamaño oficio, lapices, lapiceros, papel china, papel lustre, cuadernos, libretas, libros y servicio de copias.
El nos comenta también que  unos de sus sueños con el crédito seria engrandecer  su negocio  ya que siempre le a gustado manejar su dinero y con esfuerzo y trabajo sacar buenas ganancias.
Lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es darle una buena atención a  sus clientes y si le hacen algún pedido  de papelería tenérselos a tiempo.
Pidió el préstamo para la compra de mas artículos de papelería como son: libretas, cuadernos, hojas tamaño carta .hojas tamaño oficio, libros  y lápices.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son: 
Fernando-se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres.
Araceli Gudelia-se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres.
Claudia-se dedica a la venta de pescado.
Pablita-se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres.
Bertha-se dedica a la venta de mercancía de  abarrotes.

Le dan las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que les ha dado para salir adelante y mejorar sus vidas y las de su familia.
texts.en:
This communal bank is named "Rio Viejo" ("Old River"). It is comprised of six cheerful, hardworking people with the drive to improve themselves.
One of the group members is young Frumencio, who's 23 years old. He reports that he sells stationery items such as letter- and office-sized paper sheets, letter-sized folders, pencils, automatic pencils, tissue paper, colored paper, notebooks, booklets and books, and provides photocopy services.
He also reports that one of his dreams for this loan would be to expand his business, because he has always enjoyed managing his finances and getting good profits as a result from his efforts and hard work.
What he likes most about his business is providing good service to his customers and meeting their orders for stationery items in a timely fashion.
He requested the loan in order to purchase more stationery products such as booklets, notebooks, letter- and office-sized paper sheets, books and pencils.
The other group members are Fernando, who sells fruits and vegetables; Araceli Gudelia, who sells fruits and vegetables; Claudia, who sells fish; Pablita, who sells fruits and vegetables; and Bertha, who sells groceries.
They give thanks to Fundación for the support they have been given in order to get ahead and to improve living conditions for themselves and for their families.

loans.use: to purchase stationery items for selling.

loans.name: La Guadalupe 2 Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama La Guadalupe 2 y esta conformado por  diez integrantes todas mujeres trabajadoras y humildes con deseos  de salir adelante y triunfar en la vida.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la señora Altagracia una señora alegre y trabajadora , ella tiene  setenta y tres años de edad , se dedica a la  elaboración y venta de  tomales,quesadillas,tacos dorados y venta de dulces.
Ellas nos cuentan que lleva  cuarenta años dedicándose a  la elaboración de tamales y antojitos mexicanos que son las quesadillas y los tacos dorados.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Asunción Lugrecio un señor trabajador y humilde, con quien tiene dieciséis hijos  que ya están casados.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de más ingredientes como son: jitomate, manteca, chiles, ajos, hojas de plátano, verduras  y carnes frías.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Simona –quien se dedica a la venta de marranos.
Maria – quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Juana-quien se dedica a la venta de pan.
Ivonn-quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Isabel quien se dedica a la venta de carne.
Rosalía-quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Rosa Elia –quien se dedica a la venta de alfarería.
Eva Eugenia –quien se dedica a la venta de refrescos.
Ana Remedios-quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.

Le da las gracias a fundacion por el apoyo que les ha dado para que puedan hacer que su negocio crezca y ofrecerles una mejor vida a sus hijos que son lo  más importante para ellas.
texts.en:
This group is named La Guadalupe 2 and is made up of 10 members, all of whom are hard-working and humble women with a desire to get ahead and triumph in life.

One of the members of this group is señora Altagracia, a happy and hard-working woman.  She is 73-years-old.  She makes and sells tamales, quesadillas, and deep-fried tacos.  She also sells sweets.

The members tell us that Altagracia has made tamales and popular corn-based dishes, which are the quesadillas and deep-fried tacos, for 40 years.

She is happily married to señor Asunción Lugrecio, a hard-working and humble man, with whom she has 16 children.  They are all already married.  She asked for the loan so she can purchase more incredients like tomatoes, butter, hot peppers, plantain leaves, vegetables, and cold meats.

The other members of the group are:
Simona –who sells pigs.
Maria – who sells popular corn-based dishes.
Juana- who sells bread.
Ivonn- who sells clothing.
Isabel- who sells meat.
Rosalía- who sells clothing.
Rosa Elia – who sells pottery.
Eva Eugenia – who sells soft drinks.
Ana Remedios- who sells clothing.

They are thankful to the foundation for the support that it has given them so they can make their businesses grow and offer a better life to their children, who are the most important thing to them.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make food.

loans.name: Tukhtajon

texts.ru: Тухтажон 52 года, замужем, мать пятерых детей. Успешная,пунктуальная,трудолюбивая женщина. С 2002 года она  кредитуется в нашей организации,имеет хорошую кредитную историю. Тухтажон начинала с продажи продуктов питания. Несмотря на то, что она уже женщина в годах, тем не менее она раз в неделю ездила на оптовые рынки для закупки партий продуктов питания. На продуктовом рынке, где она торговала, многие обращались к ней за советом, как поставить торговлю, чтобы получать хорошую прибыль. Тухтажон всем помогала без отказа, и сегодня многие ей благодарны. За счет доходов от бизнеса, Тухтажон поставила на ноги всех своих детей. 3 года назад Тухтажон решила поменять направление бизнеса и заняться продажей детской одежды. И в этом бизнесе Тухтажон успешна. Сейчас начало весны и Тухтажон хочет завезти весенний ассортимент детской одежды и этим увеличить товарооборот. Тухтажон благодарна нашей организации за оказанную поддержку.
texts.en: Tukhtajon is 52 years old, married and is a mother of five children.  She is a successful, punctual and hardworking woman.  She has been a client of our organization since 2002 and has a good credit history.  Tukhtajon started with selling food products.  Despite the fact that she is an older woman, she traveled to wholesale markets no less than once per week to purchase inventories of food products.  Many people at the food market, where she worked, came to her for advice of how to set up sales in order to make a good profit.  Tukhtajon helped everyone without hesitation, and many people are grateful to her today.  Thanks to the earnings from her business, Tukhtajon put all of her children on their feet.  Three years ago, she decided to change her business focus and get involved in sales of children's clothing.  Tukhtajon is successful in this business.  It is now the beginning of spring, and Tukhtajon wants to obtain a spring selection of children's clothing and, thus, increase goods turnover.  She is grateful to our organization for the provided support.

loans.use: to buy a spring selection of children's clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a freezer

loans.name: Nizomiddin

texts.ru: Низомиддину 35 лет, женат и имеет четырех детей. Он очень любит свою семью, его друзья предлагают поехать с ними на заработки в Казахстан, но он отказался и решил развивать свой бизнес здесь. Его жена продает молоко соседям и близким, муж также привозит молочные продукты в городской рынок . Но в основном Низомиддин занимается выращиванием скота. Он получает у нас первый кредит для разведение скота. Его скот находиться на пастбище с утра до вечера, он любит свою работу.
texts.en: Nizomiddin is 35 years old, married and has four children.  He loves his family very much, and his friends offered him to go to Kazakhstan with them for work, but he turned them down and decided to develop his business here.  His wife sells milk to the neighbors and relatives, and her husband also delivers milk products to the city market.  Primarily, Nizomiddin is involved in fattening up livestock.  He is obtaining his first loan from us for fattening up livestock.  His livestock is at a pasture from morning until evening.  Nizomiddin loves his work very much.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Luttfullo

texts.ru: Лутфулло 31 год,женат, проживает в районе Спитамен. Имеет 3 детей. Лутфулло  трудолюбивый и умный человек занимается куплей продажей баранов. Он кредитуется в нашей организации с 2011 года. Имеет хорошую кредитную историю. На полученный кредит Лутфулло хочет купить 4 голов молодых баран и хочет расширить свой бизнес. В свободное время он работает таксистом. Лутфулло очень благодарен нашей организации за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Luttfullo is 31 years old, he lives in the Spitamen region. He is married and has 3 children. Luttfullo is a hard-working and intelligent person. His occupation is buying and reselling sheep. He has been a client of MDO Arvand, LLC since 2011 and has a good credit history. Using this loan, Luttfullo wants to purchase 4 young sheep and expand his business. In his free time, Luttfullo also works as a taxi driver. He is grateful to MDO Arvand, LLC for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy 4 sheep

loans.name: Marjurie Yanyna

texts.es:
Marjurie Yanyna tiene 37 años es soltera vive con la madre no tiene hijos. Vive en Montalvo Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La ventanilla se llama PITA se encuentra ubicada En el Recinto San Pablo de Pita perteneciente al Canton Caluma a 45 minutos de Montalvo esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas a mantener los cultivos de naranja, guineo, orito, cacao y café. 

Marjurie Yanyna se dedica a cuidar las plantaciones de cacao, guineo, cafe y naranja ya que estos productos son de ciclo largo, las compras las realiza en Comercial San Rafael en Caluma y las vende en Montalvo. 

El credito lo solicita para la compra de insumos como: abonos, urea y fungicidas para la malesa o mala herva, ranger para las enfermedades en los cultivos. El credito le ayudado a incrementar la calidad de los productos y evitar pérdidas en los cultivos. El sueño de Marjurie es compra mas terreno para seguir sembrando. 

Le gusta ser una persona sociable y le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Marjurie Yanyna is 37 years old. She is single, has no children, and lives with her mother. She lives in the town of Montalvo in the Los Rios Province. 

The community bank PITA is located in Recinto San Pablo de Pita, which is in Caluma municipality, about 45 minutes from Montalvo. The bank supports agriculture with most of its members growing oranges, bananas, cocoa, coffee

Marjurie Yanyna's farm grows cocoa, bananas, coffee, and oranges. She makes her purchases in Caluma and sells her products in Montalvo.

The loan will be used to buy farm supplies like: fertilizer, urea, and fungicides for when diseases affect the plants. The loan will help her improve the quality of her crops and avoid any losses. Marjurie's dream is to purchase more land and continue planting.

She considers herself a sociable person, and she likes playing sports.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers and fungicides

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La socia anteriormente se dedicaba al negocio de costurera pero no le fue muy bien en este negocio,ahora se esta dedicando al negocio de venta de frutas como naranjas,platanos,mandarinas entre otras frutas,la socia vende al por mayor a los diferentes lugares donde venden frutas,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de frutas.La socia desea el crédito para comprar frutas como naranjas ,mandarinas y platanos al por mayor.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member previously ran a tailoring business, but it was not a success. She now works selling fruits like oranges, bananas, and mandarins wholesale. She sells her products to different businesses which sell fruit. With this business she is able to support her children. She wants to expand her fruit-selling business. She will use the loan to purchase fruit wholesale.

She is happy to receive a loan and pledges to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: purchase fruit like oranges, bananas, and mandarins wholesale

loans.name: Barchinoy

texts.ru: Барчиной 32 года проживает в сельской местности, имеет дочку. Уже 9 лет занимается откормом баранов и коз. На первый кредит она увеличила поголовье молодых баранов, откормив продала, на полученную прибыль она сделала косметический ремонт дома. Ещё Барчиной занимается шитьём национальных платьев и продает их. Она кредитуется в нашей организации с 2010 года. Она хочет увеличит поголовье скота, поэтому она хочет получит у нас кредит.
texts.en: Barchinoy is 32 years old. She lives in a rural area with her daughter. She has been raising sheep and goats for 9 years. With her first loan, she increased the number of young sheep in her herd, then fattened and resold them, using the profits to redecorate her home. Barchinoy also sews traditional dresses for sale. She has been a client of MDO Arvand, LLC since 2010. Barchinoy would like to increase the size of her herd, and so is requesting a new loan.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening and reselling

loans.name: Angelica Nelida

texts.es:
Angelica tiene 42 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, El departamento de Ica es el único de la costa sur formado por planicies, también llamadas llanuras costeñas, puesto que la Cordillera de los Andes se levanta muy al interior. En Ica se encuentran extensos desiertos, como las Pampas de Lancha, las Pampas de Villacurí, en donde el calor es muy intenso, ofrece playas y aguas termales, variada fauna marina, museos de sitio y excelentes servicios de hoteles; como buena peruana le gusta mucho nuestra comida por ello uno de sus platos favoritos son los “Tallarines Rojos”, ella solo estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Enfermería.

Con mucha lucha Angelica pudo iniciar su negocio de venta de bebidas gaseosas, productos de belleza y chupetes; ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 8 horas diarias, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque sus clientes están a gusto con lo amable que es cuando los atiende.

 Angelica agradece mucho a los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo podrá compras mas mercadería (gaseosas) al por mayor y también podrá comprar productos de belleza para vender, así tendrá más variedad de productos y podrá mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando para cumplir su gran sueño:” Tener una tienda más grande y tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Angelica is 42 years old and lives in the town of Ica. The department of Ica is the only one on the south coast that is comprised of plains, also called coastal plains, since the Andes mountains arise much farther inland. In Ica there are vast deserts, such as the Pampas de Lancha and the Pampas de Villacurí, where the heat is very intense. These places offer beaches and termal waters, a varied sea fauna, onsite museums and excellent hotel services. As a good Peruvian, she very much enjoys the typical food, and one of her favorite dishes is "tallarines rojos" (tagliatelle bolognese). She only studied up to the 5th grade of middle school, but she would have liked to have studied nursing.
With a lot of hard work, Angelica was able to start her business selling soft drinks, beauty products and lollipops. She works about 8 hours a day and believes that her business is doing well because her customers are happy with how friendly she is towards them.
Angelica is very thankful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their support, she will be able to purchase more merchandise (soft drinks) by wholesale and also purchase more beauty products for selling. That way she'll have a wider variety of merchandise and she'll be able to increase her profits, which will allow her to keep on striving to achieve her biggest dream: "To own a larger store as well as my own home".

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (soft drinks).

loans.name: Altamirano Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama “Altamirano”, es de la comunidad de San Pedro, San Felipe del progreso, el grupo lo integran 7 mujeres y 1 hombre muy trabajadores, cada uno de los integrantes de este grupo son casados, y tienen a su familia, y cada uno de ellos(as) se esfuerza día a día por sacarlas adelante, ellos se dedican a criar animales como puercos, borregos, pollos y guajolotes, lo hacen con la finalidad de obtener ganancias y ayudar cuando se pueda con los gastos ya sea con los hijos en la escuela o con la despensa en la casa, también porque no trabajan, es decir no tienen un empleo fijo que les deje un sueldo y desean invertir parte del tiempo en algo que sea productivo y puedan apoyar a sus parejas para que juntos salgan adelante con todas las necesidades que actualmente se tienen, cabe mencionar que las personas de este grupo son muy responsables y trabajadoras, les gusta emprender para mejorar su vida. La comunidad de San Pedro es una de las comunidades más avanzadas del Municipio, se cuenta con todos los servicios públicos como agua y drenajes, hospital, escuelas, gasolinera, además de que es una comunidad con mucha vegetación y poblado, en fin es muy completa, y también es una comunidad que tiene muchos profesionista y muchos niños estudiando. El grupo decidió ponerle “Altamirano” porque es un nombre de un escritor importante por eso llevan ese nombre. 
Los nombres de las ocho integrantes son: 
1.-David S., tiene 42 años, quien solicita su crédito para comprar 4 borregos y pastura para alimentarlos.
2.-Victoria R., 26 años, quien solicita el dinero para compra de 2 borregos, 2 cerdos y alimento para criarlos.
3.-Patricia C. 34 años solicita su crédito para compra de 4 cerdos, 30 pollos, alimento y maíz para criarlos.
4.-Ambrosia G. 62 años solicita su crédito para la compra de 2 cerdos, 10 guajolotes, 20 pollos, alimento y maíz para criarlos.
5.-Anita R. 23 años, quien solicita el crédito para compra de 5 cerdos y alimento para criarlos.
6.-Crescencia G. 45 años, ella pide el crédito para compra de 10 cerdos, alimento y maíz para criarlos.
7.-Teresa B. 32 años, pidió el préstamo para la compra de 5 borregos y pastura para criarlos.
8.-Elvira S. 43 años, solicita el crédito para la compra de 2 cerdos, 2 borregos, alimento y maíz para criarlos.
 La representante del grupo se llama Crescencia, ella tiene 45 años de edad, y está casada desde hace 27 años con el señor Crisanto que se dedica a realizar trabajos de albañilería, juntos tienen 3 hijos, el mayor de 29 años que es casado, la que sigue tiene 20 años y de igual forma es casada y el menor de ellos tiene 17 años y está cursando el último año de su preparatoria, la señora Crescencia y su esposo viven en casa propia es decir es de ellos y no pagan renta. El motivo por el que la señora Crescencia decide unirse a este grupo es porque en él ve una motivación para emprender un negocio. "Soy una persona a la que le gusta comprar y vender mis animales, porque me doy cuenta que a veces mi esposo no tiene trabajo y yo le ayudo, soy de las personas que se dedican a muchas cosas, para ayudarme con mis gastos y ayudar a mi familia, no me gusta dejar de trabajar, me gusta estar criando constantemente y no quedarme sin  nada para ir saliendo adelante". Dice la señora Crescencia. "Mi actividad consiste en: una vez que recibo  mi préstamo me dirijo a las granjas donde venden lechones (así se le conoce a los cerdos cuando están aún muy pequeños), no tengo que salir muy lejos ya que aquí en mi comunidad hay una granja, compro los cerdos que voy a criar y los llevo a mi casa en donde tengo mi corralito, ahí les doy de comer, y los inyecto para el crecimiento, y cuando crecen les compro alimento para engorda, luego los vendo, además la gente de mi comunidad ya me conoce, sabe que yo crío puercos y ellos solitos vienen" dice muy orgullosa la señora Crescencia.
La señora Crescencia dice que hasta ahora gracias a Dios no ha tenido ninguna dificultad para llevar a cabo su actividad, no ha tenido enfermedades y en general le ha ido bien.
Las metas que la señora Crescencia tiene son muy claras, a ella le gustaría hacer arreglos en su casa con las ganancias obtenidas, pero sobre todo quiere que a sus hijos no les haga falta nada.
El préstamo que le otorga la institución, será de gran ayuda para que la señora cumpla sus metas y siga progresando.
texts.en:
The Altamarino group is from the San Pedro community in San Felipe del Progreso.  The group is comprised of seven women and one man, and they are very hard workers.  Each member of this group is married and has a family.  Each one of them strives day to day to get ahead.  They devote themselves to raising animals like pigs, sheep, chickens, and turkeys.  They do this in order to get income and to help when they can with the expenses, be it for their children in school or for the store in the house.  

Also, because they do not work, which is to say that they do not have fixed employment that gives them a salary, they wish to invest part of their time in something that will be productive so they can support their life partners.  They want to do this so that, together, they can get ahead with all of their current necessities. It is worth mentioning that the people in this group are very responsible and hard working.  They like working in order to improve their lives.

The San Pedro community is one of the most advanced communities in the municipality.  It has all of the public services like water and drainage, a hospital, schools, and a gas station.  It is also a densely populated community with a lot of vegetation.  Additionally, the community has a lot of professionals and a lot of children attending school.  The group decided upon the name of “Altamirano” because it is the name of an important writer.

The names of the eight members are:

1.-David S., age 42, is requesting his loan to buy 4 sheep and grass to feed them. 
2.-Victoria R., age 26, is requesting the loan to buy 2 sheep, 2 pigs, and feed to raise them. 
3.-Patricia C., age 34, is requesting her loan to buy 4 pigs, 30 chickens, feed, and corn to raise them. 
4.-Ambrosia G., age 62, is requesting her loan to buy 2 pigs, 10 turkeys, 20 chickens, feed, and corn to raise them. 
5.-Anita R., age 23, is requesting the loan to buy 5 pigs and food to raise them. 
6.-Crescencia G., age 45, is asking for the loan to buy 10 pigs, feed, and corn to raise them. 
7.-Teresa B., age 32, requested the loan to buy 5 sheep and grass to raise them. 
8.-Elvira S., age 43, is requesting the loan to buy 2 pigs, 2 sheep, grass, and corn to raise them. 

Crescencia, age 45, is the representative of the group.  She has been married for 27 years to Crisanto, who works as a bricklayer.  They have three children.  The oldest is 29 and married.  The next one is 20 and also married.  The youngest is 17 and is in the last year of high school.  

Crescencia and her husband live in their own house, which is to say that they do not pay rent.  The reason that Crescencia decided to join this group is because of the desire to undertake a business.  “I am a person who likes to buy and sell my animals.  This is because I realize that at times my husband does not have work, and I help him.  I am one of those people who devote themselves to many things in order to help with my expenses and to help my family.  I do not like to stop working.  I like taking care of the animals constantly so that I am not left without anything to get ahead,” says Crescencia. 

“My business activity consists of, once I receive my loan, going to the farms where they sell “lechones” (this is what the pigs are called when they are still very little).
